Text: This product helped a friend lose 50 lbs and I have lost about 10 lbs on this product with some exercise and other diet changes (low or no carbs).  Basically this is a cracker, a bread product with low calories and high fiber and is very filling.  Before I could eat a whole box of low fiber crackers and still not feel full, with these I can eat three with my favorite foods, cheese, peanut butter, butter, cream cheese and feel satisfied. Melt some brie on these in the toaster oven. Wow.  I am waiting for the box of thirty on amazon but have regularly ordered the 30 pack on the bran crisp bread site, you pay around $2 per pack.  I keep these in my backpack for school or work and in the glove box of the car for handy use.  I love bringing them to the table at a restaurant for an alternative to bread.  At a Chinese restaurant they are a great alternative for the deep fried chips.  They provide the crunchy/cracker/bread feel with high fiber and low carbs.  I can speak more highly of this product.
title: GG Bran Crispbread, 3.5-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 30)

Summary: Great Healthy Bread Substitute for Regularity, Weight Loss, & Blood Sugar control.
Text:
GG Scandinavian Crispbread is the number one recommended bread / cracker substitute by doctors, dietitians, and weight loss experts, for anyone who wants a healthier alternative to high carbohydrate breads and crackers.

Whether you just want a healthier lifestyle, want to lose weight, control blood sugar, or improved regularity - these little crispbreads are the answer.

Amazingly, these crispbreads have a shelf life in excess of 2 years and up to 5 years if you keep them in the freezer. But if you are like me - this case of 30 packages won't last more than two or three months because you will enjoy gobbling them up with tuna, cheese, hamburgers, hot dogs, or anything else that needs some digestive crunch.
title: GG Bran Crispbread, 3.5-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 30)

Summary: You want fiber?  GG's got tons of it.
Text:
It would probably be better to not think of these as crackers so much as a convenient fiber suppliement. These crackers look exactly like particle board. They are utterly without taste. The texture is pretty crisp and sturdy, and be prepared to do some chewing and wash them down with plenty of liquid least they utterly dry out your mouth and throat.

This might sound like a negative review so far, but I actually like these things. Their lack of any flavor renders them absolutlely neutral in terms of whatever you want to top them with. At different times I've put hummus, cheese, nuttella, tuna salad and peanut butter on them to good effect. The taste like whatever you top them with, period. I wouldn't want to eat these things plain, but I really see no need to try.

As far as the fiber thing goes, well, I'll try to stay away from TMI territory, but they work very well. If you have any troubles at all with constipation you can do away with them once and for all with this product. They also work decently as a filling snack if you are trying to cut back on calories.

These are definatly not my favorite cracker to eat, but as a fiber suppliment, they simply cannot be beat.
title: GG Bran Crispbread, 3.5-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 30)

Summary: This is delicious, nutritious, and can help with weight loss...IF...
Text:
I took a chance and ordered 30 packages of these. 2 net grams of carbs from a thick bran cracker...how could a low-carb dieter like me resist? My first thought was to use this with peanut butter. Yummy and yay! It is delicious. I use sunbutter, though almond butter could work too. Even Smart Balance peanut butter is low carb--and goes great with this crispbread. The secret...the big if...don't eat the cracker by itself! I don't even eat saltines by themselves, much less a thick bran cracker. Yet, I think some, who find this product untasty are doing that.

There are some nasty-bad tasting diet products out there. However, this crispbread, imported from Norway, is very good--again, with some nice spread on it.

Final advice--shop around. If you are willing to buy bulk, some vendors can get it to you for less than $3 a package.
title: GG Bran Crispbread, 3.5-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 30)

Text: Bought these after receiving a sample of the other GG Bran product, the sprinkles (great for yogurt), and hearing great things about the crisp bread. I added two of these crackers with no-fat cream cheese to my usual breakfast this morning and what a difference! For an extra 60 or so calories (24 for the crackers and 30ish for the cream cheese)I am noticeably less hungry come lunch time. Usually by noon I am hungry, and on the days I work out in the morning by noon I'm starving. Today I worked out and at noon I wasn't hungry at all and it's 1:00 now and I'm thinking I might as well have my lunch because I have some time but I'm only barely hungry, could definitely wait another hour + if I needed. I will start taking these to work to use as an afternoon snack - I can't believe how filling and long lasting they are! They would be great with a bit of nut butter, low/non-fat cream cheese, or some other low cal spread like the laughing cow cheese wedges. Wouldn't eat on their own though because they are very dry, but great with a spread!
title: GG Bran Crispbread, 3.5-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 30)

Text:
If you just can't eat scrambled eggs, soup or a salad without toast or crackers this is just for you. This size is for the serious folks who have tried the brancrisps and like that they are crunchy and have little taste.

This is great if you are looking for LOW SODIUM, LOW FAT, HIGH FIBER. An impossible to find combo!! A great foundation for a snack; a great bread-like addition to a meal. DON'T eat alone!!! Crumble up in your cereal, munch on with just a little something on top. These will stay fresh for a couple of years so I've bought the single pack at the grocery and went for the 30-pack box so I always have on hand.
title: GG Bran Crispbread, 3.5-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 30)

Text: These are the most delicious steel cut oats I have found, and they're certified to be gluten-free too!  They're yummy and satisfying and give me long-lasting energy all morning.  Since I'm always rushed in the morning, I put them in the pan at night and soak them in water.  I use more water than the directions call for (maybe about four times as much water as oats).  If you're going to add raisins, you can soak those right along with the oats.  Then in the morning I just turn the heat on, bring them to a boil, cover and turn down to the lowest simmer.  I like to cook them for 20 minutes, and they cook while I'm showering.  They don't need to be stirred at all as long as you keep the heat really low and use plenty of water.  Afterwards, I let them sit in the pan until I'm ready, and then before I eat them, I mix in a tablespoon of chia seeds.  Not only does this add even more soluble fiber and omega 3 fatty acids, but it thickens up the porridge perfectly.  Yum!
title: Bob's Red Mill Gluten Free Steel Cut Oats, 24 Oz (4 Pack)

Text:
I cook my oats in a crockpot overnight. I throw in cinnamon, diced apples and a little organic raw apple juice in place of 50% of the water. Between the apples and apple juice the oatmeal needs no additional sugar and my house smells amazing in the morning when we all wake up!
Love Scottish Oats!

Text: So why only 4 stars?  Those who are suffering from celiac disease know that oats are controversial because they are usually cross-contaminated with gluten because of the machines that process these grains.  Bob's is the only company I am aware of that has actually built an entire facility just for the processing of gluten free products. As much as those in the celiac world appreciate these efforts, there is some research showing that different oat cultivars have varying degrees of toxicity for celiac sufferers. (see the link [...]) I have emailed Bob's about this research to see if they know whether the cultivar(s) they process are the offending ones but have not received a response yet.  When I do I will be sure to update this review.
title: Bob's Red Mill Gluten Free Steel Cut Oats, 24 Oz (4 Pack)

Text: I have enjoyed these cracker snacks for more than 10 years.  They are great alone or with cheese & wine.  Don't let them go too far past the freshness date on the package.  I purchased some from Amazon in August of 2011 for about $27/case.  The price is now $45/case.  Each 4.25 oz box retails for about $2.  Great product and I love Amazon, but you've got to watch the price.

Summary: Excellent product with one overwhelming problem
Text:
Tastes good, convenient, and gluten free. Purchased for $2/box at my local WholeFoods.

The big problem is the oxygen-absorbing packets. I don't like these things in my food. I like the packaging otherwise, but I am a little disturbed after pulling multiple packets that say "do not eat"" from my food. Yes
initial_identifier:
multiple ""freshness packets"" in a single box.

Real food spoils
title: etc.
brand: and we should not fear that fact. When I encounter too many chemical agents and artificial ingredients
item_type_keyword: I tend to stay away from the product and make my own instead. Sorry about the negative review
listing_url: but little plastic packets should not be in boxes of food. I sliced open one of these packets
medium_image:
and what came out was fine black powder and brown granules.

I am pleased that the Amazon product info page currently warns about these packets. The warning is also printed in tiny white letters on the tops of the boxes
product_type_name: although it should probably be listed near the ingredients for the benefit of consumers."

Text: You'll never go back.  Can't say it any better. Parmesan and rosemary is my favorite. Worth every penny.  So good!
title: Quinn Popcorn: Microwave Popcorn Reinvented {Lemon & Sea Salt}

Text:
I loved the eco-friendly focus of this brand, but it was the taste of this flavor that really won me over. I wasn't sure what to expect, but it was delicious -- the lemon added a freshness that you don't normally expect from popcorn, and the sea salt was just right.

The oil and spice pouches are generous -- in fact, we popped extra plain popcorn that we had at home to use the leftover oil and lemon/sea salt. All in all, a great product, and I'm looking forward to ordering more.
title: Quinn Popcorn: Microwave Popcorn Reinvented {Lemon & Sea Salt}

Text:
I was lucky enough to try these out as part of their Kickstarter campaign a month ago.

If you like the salty and sour, this is the popcorn for you. The popcorn itself is also delicious, but the seasonings just bring it to a whole new level.

And let's not forget how organic and chemical-free it is. Feel free to even pop your own popcorn with a popcorn machine - tastes great even still!

You have to try all three flavours! (My personal favorite is the Vermont Maple/Sea Salt)
title: Quinn Popcorn: Microwave Popcorn Reinvented {Lemon & Sea Salt}

Text: I enjoy popcorn and I do like the convenience of microwave popcorn but not all of the chemicals that are associated with it.  I was looking for something that had fewer chemicals but still had good flavor.  Quinn Lemon and Sea Salt popcorn is wonderful.  The popcorn is popped dry in the bag and they you add the oil packet and seasoning packet so if you want less oil or less salt you can control that.  I was amazed at how lemony it was, which was a nice change from plain.  The popcorn was nice and crispy and popped well.
title: Quinn Popcorn: Microwave Popcorn Reinvented {Lemon & Sea Salt}

Summary: So good! But you can cut the oil.
Text:
The meyer lemon & sea salt is delicious and the packaging is adorable. The popcorn popped well in my microwave though the bag is a little tough to open cleanly. I remove a full tablespoon of oil from the packet before adding it to the popcorn. This saves a lot of fat and calories and the popcorn is still delicious.

My only complaint: the nutrition facts (like a lot of microwave popcorn) take an advanced degree in calculus to understand because they're based on UNpopped popcorn and the popped calculations are based on cups intead of ounces. Who eats popcorn unpopped?
title: Quinn Popcorn: Microwave Popcorn Reinvented {Lemon & Sea Salt}

Summary: My son is named Quinn which is why I tried this popcorn.  Now I tell him I named him after the popcorn!
Text: I was fortunate to run across these great people and company when they launched their Kickstarter campaign.  I watched the process of them growing and now placing product on Amazon.  Crowdsourcing can be magical!  My family loves the Vermont Maple Syrup and Salt the best, however, the Lemon and Sea Salt is my favorite!  Good for you.  No Con Agra crap.  Just popcorn, oil, and seasoning.  I would love to see a spicy version (buffalo, cajun, etc.  Keep up the good work.
title: Quinn Popcorn: Microwave Popcorn Reinvented {Lemon & Sea Salt}

ProfileName: Chef Stacy "Gluten Free and Allergy Friendly ..."
Summary: NO cross contamination possible - safe for GF diets!!
Text:
I just got my order so I'm not here to comment on how the product behaves for my particular baking needs, but I can say that before I ordered the product I called the company with concerns about the possibility of cross-contamination of their nut flours.

I was diagnosed with celiac disease, only after significant damage nearly killed me. Even after years of healing on a GF Diet, my digestive tract is severely damaged. I have to be ever vigilant about my product choices.

All food reactions should be carefully examined, but they should not be immediately or unduly blamed on gluten contamination. I don't work for nor do I currently receive any form of consideration from this company. This endorsement is strictly so others can make an informed decision!

Their number is (888)-810-3212. I recommend you call since manufacturing practices are subject to change, even though it seemed that this company is committed to providing a safe product for celiacs and others on a GF diet.

I asked if I could quote them and got their permission to write:

" Nut flours are processed in a separate facility which ONLY processes nut flours. Therefore
initial_identifier:
there's NO possibility of cross-contamination during manufacturing from gluten.""

I am very comfortable using and recommending this product from a Gluten free point of view. I shall update the review here and on my blog as I use their flours in recipe formulation.

[...]"

Summary: Buy the 5 lb bag, not 25 lb box!
Text:
I LOVE this flour. It has a great texture and is perfect for my gluten-free and low-carb needs. I would highly recommend that you buy this flour - but only in the 5 lb size.

I love it and use it so much that I thought I'd try to be more economical and buy the 25 lb box direct from Honeyville's site. I was so excited to start baking that I opened it up the second I got in the door. I found it was packed in an UNSEALED blue garbage bag inside of a cardboard box, and was completely infested with ants. YUCK!!!

I'm extremely cheap, but having bugs in my baking supplies completely grossed me out. I don't see how they would keep this from happening again in the future, given the way that they pack the bulk boxes. On Honeyville's site you can get a smaller discount for buying at least six 5 lb bags, but to me it's worth it to know that I'm getting a safe food product.

[...]

Carrot Cake

Cake:

4 cups almond flour - scooped
2 cups sugar free sweetener - (I use 1-1/2 cups Splenda & 1/2 cup Erythritol)
2 teaspoons baking powder
2 teaspoons baking soda
1/2-teaspoon salt
1 tablespoons ground cinnamon
1/2-teaspoon ground ginger
1/4-teaspoon ground nutmeg
1 tablespoons vanilla
1/4-cup oil
4 eggs
1/2-cup sour cream
1/2 pound frozen carrots - thawed - finely chopped
1 cup chopped pecans

Frosting: 1/4-cup butter - softenened
8 ounces cream cheese - softened
1 teaspoons vanilla Sweetener to taste

Preheat oven to 350° Spray a 9x13-inch cake pan with cooking spray.

In a large bowl combine dry ingredients and stir well.

Beat the eggs with the oil and the vanilla...add to the dry ingredients along with the sour cream and mix well. Stir in carrots and pecans. Pour into prepared pan and bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes or until toothpick inserted in the middle of the cake comes out clean and cake is firm to the touch.

Remove from the oven to a wire rack and cool completely.

To Make Frosting: Combine ingredients and beat with a wire whisk until smooth. Sweeten to taste and frost cake.
Here's a carrot cake recipe that I just made and it taste's just like regular cake.

Summary: Poor Quality Control! Ants in Ripped Flour Bag
Text:
I was excited when I ordered this yesterday and it was to be delivered today. I had almost everything I needed for the next phase in my diet, but the almond meal flour. After reading reviews and the ingredients I went ahead and ordered. I came home for the delivery only to find that ants were all in the box it was shipped in. Needless to say I was even more disgusted when I discovered the seam on the side of the bag was open and had not been sealed correctly and that the ants were all in the bag crawling around! The box was not left outside so no, it was not sitting waiting on me to get it. I immediately got online and had to initiate a return. If you do decide to order from this company, open the box outside and check the bag for bugs. I will not be ordering from them again. I will try to post an image later to show what I meant about the ants. I had to take the bag and put it in large ziplock gallon bags (two facing each other) and put it into the freezer until I can put it back in the box, seal it, and return to sender. I order a lot off amazon and this is the first thing I have ever had come to me with this problem. The ants may have come from an Amazon warehouse, or FedEx, but the poor quality control on the bag was from the manufacturer.

Update: I contacted amazon through the chat and informed them about my concern about sending a bag with insects back to them. I also shared I had posted images on this product page. They said I could discard it and they would process my refund. I do say that I am and have always been happy with the fact Amazon backs up the products they ship and aim for good customer service. I am not going to increase the rating because the ants wouldn't have gotten in the bag or probably been there if it wasn't torn and sealed properly at the manufacturer level.
title: Honeyville Farms Blanched Almond Meal Flour, 5 lb

Summary: Not as happy as I wanted to be
Text:
For our inaugural attempt at baking with almond meal, we used our old standby scone recipe, which results in 8 delicious but massively carby scones, light and fluffy.

Substituting almond meal 1:1 (which was a total guess because there were no instructions on the bag about how to substitute) for the flour, we ended up with a very runny-ish dough. I know it won't get as dough-like as wheat flour, but this was almost like cooked oatmeal, it was so runny. So we ended up doubling the amount of flour, therefore, 2:1 ratio to regular flour, and the scones came out (a) crumbly and (b) salty. I did add the regular amount of sugar to my recipe but it was apparently not enough to counteract the saltiness of the almonds. Each of us choked down one scone with a lot of milk, and five more were tossed in the back yard for the birds.

We will next attempt to make oatmeal-raisin cookies with it, and if that's as bad a fail, then we will not even bother with this product again.
title: Honeyville Farms Blanched Almond Meal Flour, 5 lb

Text: I originally bought one package in a local store to try and immediately fell in love with them; they are so yummy!  Amazon has them at a great price too.  For anyone who enjoys sushi, or a salty snack without all the bad stuff that's in chips, these are awesome.  The seaweed taste is nicely enhanced by the sea salt.  And each package has only 60 calories.  They won't fill you up by any means, but when you have a craving for something salty, this fits the bill.  My only complaint is I wish they came in larger packages.
title: Annie Chun's Roasted Seaweed Snacks, Sesame, 0.35-ounce (Pack of 12), America's #1 Selling Seaweed Snacks

Text:
These seaweed snacks were an impulse item, and I'm so glad we tried them. There are 12 individually sealed packages in the box, and each package has about 20 super-thin seaweed snacks. They're almost thin enough to read through, and the whole container only has 2 carbs, making them perfect for low-carb dieters. They're surprisingly filling, and not overly salty. They are extremely crispy and the entire package should be eaten soon after opening. Humidity will make them gummy in just a short time.

The nutrition information from Annie Chun's website says that each package of this sesame flavor has: 60 calories, 2 grams protein, 140 mg sodium, 5 grams of fat, 70% of daily vitamin A, 12% of daily vitamin C, and minerals (unnamed on the ingredients list).

I like that these are all-natural and don't contain preservatives or food coloring. I like that it's a novel way to eat vegetables, and that my kids love them. Next we'll try the wasabi flavor.

My only complaint about this product is that they use canola oil in them. Canola oil is in so many foods we eat, and the process used to make it (hexane - a petroleum product, and high heat) causes it to produce free radicals in our body. Free radicals are linked to obesity, heart disease and degenerative diseases in our bodies. I would much prefer that all foods be made with cold-pressed oils like olive, peanut or sunflower oil.

But canola oil aside, these seaweed snacks are delicious, filling, low carb, and we'll be buying them again.
title: Annie Chun's Roasted Seaweed Snacks, Sesame, 0.35-ounce (Pack of 12), America's #1 Selling Seaweed Snacks

Summary: I really like these; they've inspired me to make my own
Text:
I'd been curious about seaweed snacks for quite some time. After trying a pack of Annie Chun's Seaweed Snacks, I have to say I am a fan. The snacks are perfect as just that -- a snack. They have 60 calories per container so you don't have to feel bad about eating one or two containers.

The seaweed is thin but has a crispy component. There is a bit of salt but I wouldn't say that these are anywhere near as salty as a Lay's potato chip. Initially, the smell of the seaweed seemed very strong. I don't eat fish but that was all I could think of when eating the first few pieces. After a while, I didn't notice the scent so much.

There are two things that I don't like about this product. The first is the amount of packaging. The second is the use of canola oil. To deal with both, I've started to make my own snacks. I use nori and apply coconut oil or sesame oil and salt and place it in the oven for a bit. For those that think these are too salty, the make your own method allows you to control the amount of oil and salt.

Made in Korea.

If interested in trying a single package of Annie Chun's and your grocery store does not carry the product, try iherb.com. If interested in iherb, you can use code LEK375 for a discount.
title: Annie Chun's Roasted Seaweed Snacks, Sesame, 0.35-ounce (Pack of 12), America's #1 Selling Seaweed Snacks

Text: This year was rough for our zoo...we had layoffs and closed some exhibits and some animals went to other zoos. It was hard for all of us. So I took it upon myself to lift the spirit of my fellow co-workers. I have ordered these cookies with some very specific personalized funny fortunes (like: Zookeeper Motto #9: This crap never gets old.)  I plan to give them out to all my friends at work, for Christmas.  I will keep you all posted...stay tuned.
title: Greenfire Custom Fortune Cookies, Bulk, Traditional Vanilla, Kosher (60 count)

Text: I contacted the company to order a set of customized fortune cookies for my parents' 40th wedding anniversary. They worked with me to quickly create the cookies and ship them to me as I had a little more than a week to go til the party. Excellent experience, cookies arrived quickly, tasted good and the fortune was exactly as the mockup had shown. Quite pleased! :)
title: Greenfire Custom Fortune Cookies, Bulk, Traditional Vanilla, Kosher (60 count)

Summary: The best idea for my holiday party!!!
Text: I ordered the Custom Fortune Cookies with less than a week's notice to Greenfire.  Jen from Greenfire immediately contacted me and through email, we were able to get the logistics together for the delivery of the cookies for my annual holiday party.  Jen was great!  She really got me motivated to be very creative with the fortunes, telling me to cater them to the people that would be at my party.  It was so much fun coming up with the fortunes!  The cookies were delivered right on time from Seattle to New Jersey (Jen even called me to alert me of the delivery because she was actively tracking the package).  Not only were the cookies packed well (only one cracked cookie!), but they tasted so fresh.  These were the best fortune cookies that I have ever had.  They were also a big hit at my party!  Everyone loved them!!
title: Greenfire Custom Fortune Cookies, Bulk, Traditional Vanilla, Kosher (60 count)

Text: Cookies were perfect, they taste great, arrived on time, and the messages were printed beautifully. I am ordering them for other events!
title: Greenfire Custom Fortune Cookies, Bulk, Traditional Vanilla, Kosher (60 count)

Text: I ordered these for a baby shower, and what a wonderful product! Greenfire worked with me to perfect my cookie phrases, answered all of my questions quickly, and made sure to get them to me when they were fresh and delicious! Would recommend to anyone for a shower, birthday, bachelor party, wedding...so many uses!
title: Greenfire Custom Fortune Cookies, Bulk, Traditional Vanilla, Kosher (60 count)

Text: I'm a repeat customer. After the success I had with the first round of fortune cookies last year, I decided to order more cookies for the night of the Opening Ceremonies of the Olympics. A representative of Greenfire and I worked together and came up with 60 different Olympics-related fortunes and I ordered three pounds of them. My staff loved them. I brought them to a meeting at the start of the day, and we spent almost as much time reading the fortunes to each other as we spent working. After the meeting, I left them out for the staff go nibble away at, and by the end of the night, all three pounds were gone. I got a kick out of hearing my staff laughing at the fortunes we came up with. Two successful rounds of fortunes, and I plan on being back for a third round.
title: Greenfire Custom Fortune Cookies, Bulk, Traditional Vanilla, Kosher (60 count)

Text: I wanted to surprise my daughter, who is 4 years old, with personalized fortunes for her class for Valentine's Day. When the fortunes were read out loud, she loved that they were from her.  It truly made her feel special and she just loved them.  I will definitely order them again, soon.  Thank you Greenfire!!!
title: Greenfire Custom Fortune Cookies, Bulk, Traditional Vanilla, Kosher (60 count)

Text:
I got some fortune cookies for the staff in my office as a fun way to lift people's spirits.

Jen (the owner of Greenfire) and I came up with the fortunes. Most of the fortunes were inside jokes that only my staff would get. The staff loved them! We went through the batch way too fast (I wish I had ordered more). They kept wanting to read what the next fortune said. At the end of the day, I walked around and saw my staff had taped some to their computer monitors.

I almost forgot to mention, the cookies taste really good, too. They are full of flavor, much better than the ones you get from the Chinese takeout down the street.
title: Greenfire Custom Fortune Cookies, Bulk, Traditional Vanilla, Kosher (60 count)

Text: The cookies got here.  They were nicely packed, a few cookies had gotten broken, but we just ate them first.  The fortunes were nicely decorated and the cookie tasted great!  Thank you.
title: Greenfire Custom Fortune Cookies, Bulk, Traditional Vanilla, Kosher (60 count)

Summary: A great alternative to traditional oatmeal!
Text: I bought this on a whim, hoping it would be different from traditional oatmeal.  I am happy to say that this product is wonderful!  I can not eat regular oatmeal because to me it is gooey, sticky and just gross.  But this Oat Bran is great.  No gooey texture, very easy to prepare and very healthy.  I pour some in a bowl, add milk and microwave for about a minute and half.  Add a little bit of brown sugar and some dried cranberries and it makes for a great, filling breakfast.  I am so glad I took a chance on this product and I will definitely buy more again.
title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

Summary: 2 minutes and you're tucking in to Delish
Text: For 2 servings, boil 2 cups water (with salt if you like) and add 2/3rds cup oat cereal. It's very runny at first as you're preparing it, and you may wonder, how on earth does this become into a perfect 5* cereal....but then it magically thickens....oh my! I add butter, honey and if I am feeling particularly naughty, cream instead of milk. My husband who is not a healthy food eater by any stretch of the imagination, loves this stuff... we have just received our 3rd box of 4 cereals on subscription. It's much cheaper on Amazon than our local "health food"" store."
title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

Text: I am reordering, so, clearly, I like this cereal.  I normally have it for breakfast at work.  I put some cereal and hot water from the coffee machine in a big coffee mug with lid, mix well, cover, and let it sit for 5 minutes.  At this point I add some Craisins, mix again, cover, and let it sit until it cools down (another 5 minutes). I like the flavor, and the fact that it has no added salt.  At about 2.50 per bag the price is good too.

Summary: Good for anytime of the day
Text: First of all, I've never tasted any Oat Bran prior to ordering Bob's Red Mill Oat Bran.  Upon receipt I made one serving to test it out.  I added some stevia sweetener and a little milk and butter.  I ended up making 2 more servings and gobbled those down too!  After a few days went by, I laid off the butter and milk and now eat it with mainly just a little stevia.  I can eat this anytime of the day and I've had it for dinner too!  It taste delicious for a hot cereal and very filling.  I went through one bag in 4 days :)  But, now I'm down to eating it only for breakfast.  I guess it so easy to make it has been my go to meal when I get hungry and want something that is wholesome.  I definitely recommend this oat bran if you're trying to get more fiber in your diet and want something that is D-licious.
title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

Summary: Healthy, filling, great tasting, cooks in 2 minutes.
Text: I love this product, it cooks in 2 minutes and good for you. I only cook what I can eat in one day, left overs are not good for you. I get the 4 pack and I keep the one I am using in a canning jar with lid on, the rest go into the refrigerator till I need them.  That way they are at their peak of freshness.  I hope to have time to grind it up in my BlendTec blender into flour and mix some in with white whole wheat flour and make some no-knead bread.  Amazon has the book Health Bread in Five Minutes a Day, check it out. Another good one is Kneadlessly Simple: by Nancy Baggett.

ProfileName: Bartok Kinski "A casual stroll through the lu..."
Text:
This is an excellent midnight Hot Cereal for 24 hr wheelchair racers who need that extra brain in their diet. It's very healthy, keeps you on your stumps and even is good for the tongue or back bone.

But don't make it too hot or you'll burn your fingers if you don't have a fork or straw. It builds muscle tone, eye cordination, keeps calcium levels in check and improves overall digestive systems and opens clogged gas tracts.

You can use any type of milk to prep it, but I prefer warm camel milk. You can even eat it raw if you have no stove, old newspapers, stick logs, or propane tank nearby.
title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

Summary: Delicious and healthy. No cooking is strictly needed
Text:
I like oat bran because of its high soluble fiber content and low glycemic index.

When I bought it, I thought you have to cook it but instead its delicious even with no cooking. I eat mine raw, with kefir, so you could use it for instance in yogurt, straight from the bag. This means less processing, so you wont increase its glycemic index by breaking down carbs through high temperatures, and you will preserve all of its nutrients.

The price is good, with the subscribe and save it is cheaper than I could find in any local store.
title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

Summary: Best serendipitous mistake I ever made! Wonderful product!
Text: I ordered this on accident. For some reason I thought I was getting Steel Cut Oats that I buy all the time. I was disappointed when I saw my mistake. AND THEN! I tried it. I absolutely, positively love this cereal! It has changed my morning routine. I put the required amount into the microwave with water-in less than 2 minutes it is done. I mix it with Almond milk(I love cow's milk, but it doesn't love me :(  ) I sweeten the mix with a dusting of stevia sweetener. You don't need very much stevia as it is very sweet. This makes a thick satisfying "shake"". Easy to drink and take as you drive to work. I have also added various add-ins and it just gets better and better. I have added cherry juice concentrate/raisins/cranberries/almonds/flax seed...the list goes on and on. But no matter what I add or don't add I love the texture and the taste. It is the best mistake I ever made. Thank you to the universe for this serendipitous mistake. Oh yes
initial_identifier: it reminds me of when I was young and my mother made us Cream of Wheat ""shakes"" for breakfast. I can't have wheat anymore either...so this makes me so happy to find this product!!! YAY!"
title: B000ED9L9E
brand: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

Summary: I eat this every single day!
Text:
I use this oat bran every single day. Some days I use it in smoothies as an extra fiber source, and on cold days I cook it up with some maple syrup and frozen berries. This is the far best that you can buy. I tried everything, and this is what I ended up with.

The oats it makes are soft and creamy. The smoothie isnt gritty or chewy. Its just a perfectly ground blend.
title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

Really lovely. Easy to fix (cook for 2 minutes

Text: My father-in-law recommended that I get the flax seed mill, as part of a healthier, more nutritious diet. I ordered the flax seed mill and noticed the muffin recipe on the back that I wanted to try, especially after all of the wonderful reviews here. Only one problem...I hadn't gotten the oat bran. So I ordered it, then tried the muffin recipe and...WHOA!!! Absolutely fantastic! Then I tried it as a hot cereal, adding a tbsp of the flax seed mill, a dash of salt, a few chopped walnuts, frozen blueberries and a touch of maple syrup. OMHolyGod, is this stuff tasty!!! So, I have a bowl of it for breakfast, and maybe a bowl for lunch (if I'm in a rush, I'll pack a couple of the muffins). It's so light and filling, without making you "full""
initial_identifier: and you can rest assured knowing that you're getting all the fiber you need for the day. Keeps me regular (an added bonus)
asin: and my cholesterol in check. I'm a very happy gal!!!"
title: B000ED9L9E

Text: I add flax seeds to foods regularly and have been enjoying oat bran for years.  Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal is my preferred brand, so it's great to find it offered at Amazon.  Known to add fiber and help reduce cholesterol levels, having this every day in one form or another is beneficial and can be very tasty, too.  The package contains a great muffin recipe and the Bob's Red Mill website offers additional recipes.  I'm currently reading the Dukan Diet book and see that one of the requirements for that program is to consume a tablespoon and a half of oat bran on a daily basis which sounds good to me.  He provides a little recipe for an oat bran pancake which I'll try.  I imagine that with the publication of this book in the USA, the interest in this product will skyrocket and that's a good thing.  Oat bran makes a great addition to bread doughs as well and you might even consider it in your next home made pizza.  This is much more than a hot cereal.
title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

Text:
It's a bit less nutrients than steel-cut oats, but on the positive side, it's exceptionally fast to cook, literally a couple of minutes; I stir it into boiling water, then add about one-square-inch-worth of torn-up orange peel, then -- bubble-bubble toil and trouble -- stir it from a few secs to maybe a minute (on high heat), then cover and turn it off, and go about my business, take a shower or something. When I'm back it's ready.

The texture is kinda like thick glue (depending on the amount of water: unlike steel-cut oats, this seems capable of sucking in any amount of water); the taste is sufficiently different from steel-cut oats so you can alternate them on consecutive days w/o feeling you're eating the same thing. I like to add a teaspoon of butter, two-three tablespoons of sunflower seeds, one cut-up banana (combined with the orange peel tastes great), and sprinkle on a bit of either sugar or parmesan. Comes out pretty nice! I wouldn't eat it every day, but every other day is fine. And the price (ten bucks a package) is quite good too. Nothing to complain about! Five stars. And thanks to other reviewers, 'cause I bought this thing to try after reading these reviews here. They're not lying! It's good stuff.
title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

Summary: Rich, mellow flavor; not clumpy; lots of fiber; no gas
Text: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Cereal can be described in both flavor and texture as somewhat akin to cream of wheat. It is also darker than and tastes richer than Quaker Oat Bran Cereal which, I believe, contains some of the whole oat making it pastier and clumpier. Quaker's oat bran cereal cooks very much the same way that steel cut oats cook which have been ground in a coffee grinder; i.e. very clumpy. Bob's Red Mill Oat Bran cereal clumps a lot less and does not taste pasty. It is a very good cereal and very high in fiber. Furthermore, I eat it twice per day without any unwanted digestive fireworks, whereas the equivalent of oatmeal or steel cut oats would, to say the least, overwhelm. I highly recommend this cereal.
title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

Summary: Better than expected (and I always have high expectations for Bob's Red Mill products)
Text: Texture of the cooked product is simply wonderful. Despite the instructions on the back I double the cook time (to about 5 mins.) so it gets more creamy. This is an oat bran, so you shouldn't expect much flavor, but I usually add a tablespoon of maple syrup during cooking, throw some fruit on top afterwards and it is beyond good. Btw, I use milk to cook it in, not water. I only bought this a day ago, but I'm already loving it. Oh, and it's ridiculously cheap too (for what you get).
title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

Text:
Many 'health foods' are controversial, do they really improve your health? Not oatbran. All doctors and medical tests have shown oatbran reduces 'bad' types of cholesterol. You have to eat lots of it, a half cup a day some studies show.

The easiest method is switching to homemade bread. Pure oatbran is not a good flour because it will not 'raise' nearly as much as say white wheat flour. The reasonable method to use it is to substitute oat bran cereal for other flours directly, volume per volume. We have done this for years at our house in all bread recipes. We use 1/2 oatbran and 1/2 white flour. For odd number amounts we use the extra number of oatbran (example: 5 cups of flour called for in recipe, we use 2 cups white 3 cups oatbran cereal).

Bread takes time and kneading so our homemade bread is really biscuits. We use store-bought bread for sandwiches and homemade biscuits for everything else.

=======================
Offtopic bonus:

Here is our daily recipe for 6 biscuits made in toaster oven in 6 cup pan.

1/2 cup white flour
3/4 cup oatbran cereal
1/2 teaspoon sugar
1/8 teaspoon salt
2 teaspoons baking powder
3 ounces milk
1 egg
1 tablespoon cooking oil
some spray-on non stick oil

spray pan cups with spray-on oil
bake 20 minutes 425 degrees.

chopped nuts, vanilla flavoring, nutmeg, cinnamon etc
can be used to flavor.

salt, sugar substitutes can be used (healthier?)

2 eggwhites instead of 1 whole egg can be used (healthier).

Powder milk and egg powder allows storage out of a refrigerator and for camping trips.

PAM is too thin to stick to cup sides,
all other brands spray-on oil tried are
thicker and sticks very well.
title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

Summary: Tastier than local bulk with same protein & fiber goodness
Text:
Normally I get my organic oat bran from Whole Foods bulk section, but decided to try Amazon's Bob's Red since it's free delivery with same price, about 2.15 per pound. Wow! it much tastier with the same organic, protein and fiber goodness. Highly recommend and will buy again. I prefer oat bran because it has more fiber & less carbohydrate compared to steel cut oats. No blood sugar spike for me on this product and yummy too with cinnamon, stevia and berries.

Ordered on March 1, 2012, and product has sell by date of 7/2013. One bag of 18 oz has 12 servings of 40g or 1/3 cup.
Calories: 150, Calories from fat 20. Total fat 2g, Saturated fat 0.5g, zero trans fat. Total Carbohydrate 27g, Fiber 7g, Sugar 0g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 2%, Calcium 2%, Iron 10%. Certified organic by QAI and USDA Organic.

Summary: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran works astoundingly well!
Text: When my husband and I started the Dukan Diet from dukandiet.com we were told to buy Oat Bran and eat a couple tablespoons of it every morning. So we did.  The results were and still are amazing. The necessary fiber that we receive from this product is just right for our bodies to react the right way.  The Oat Bran is filling and provides that fuller feeling of satiety for hours until lunchtime.  We both are very pleased with the flavor of the Oat Bran and a half packet of Splenda.  It's a perfect combination, gentle on your stomach and bowels, a pleasant alternative to sugars and is much more healthy for you than any other Oat Brans out there that we've tried - and we've tried quite a few.  We now buy this product in boxes of 4 bags each and have no intentions of stopping its daily use, even after the diet is done.  Thanks to the company that makes it, thanks to Dr. Pierre Dukan for the knowledge on using it, and thanks to Amazon.com for recommending it with the purchase of the Dukan Diet book.
title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

Summary: a quality product cheaper on Amazon then in health food stores
Text: The Amazon price can't be beat because four plastic bags cost nearly eighteen dollars in the specialty health food stores and only about half that if you take the annual subscription on Amazon to have them automatically mailed to your home each month and faithfully stay with it until the price drops. A very healthy product which may take some effort at home to transfer to regular containers to keep the supply fresh after opening the plastic bags, and also to soak in water before cooking, but is more than worth it for the special ingredients which are hard to find outside commercial food supplements if you seek them elsewhere.
title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

Text: This is my favorite oat bran, and I've tried many many brands. I like that this is a slightly larger bran flake, so it doesn't get so mushy when you cook it. I've had some brands where the bran is practically powder, so when you cook it, it turns to wallpaper paste. This is not that kind! It really holds its own, and I eat it every day: in the morning, mixed with Scottish oats, and I also use it to make my own granola. Love it!
title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

Text: My goodness. For me, this is one of the great discoveries in my life. I've been trying to get my fiber some way. I've been forcing myself oatmeal for all these years, rolled oats, steal cut, you name it. I eat whole wheat pasta which gives me some fiber and eat beans occasionally but how I longed for something that was quick and easy and provided the fiber I needed. Well guess what. This isn't just quick and easy. Bob's Oat Bran is like eating dessert. A delicacy you never get tired of. And it's EXTREMELY good for you. What's the catch you say. No catch. Just plain incredible goodness that will improve your life.
title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

Text: It's only 1 ingredient, cooks fast and tastes great - what more could you ask for?  When I ordered this I wondered if it was similar to Malt O Meal and it is.  I like mine on the thicker side so I make up a bowl with a little over a 1/2 C of oats and 1.25 C of water.  I microwave it on 50% power (1200 watt oven) for 3 minutes and it's great.  Then I add Splenda and a little Silk - yum!
title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

Summary: Quick and easy breakfast - almost instant!
Text: Unlike a lot of the reviewers here, I'm not on a special diet that requires oat bran. I've purchased Bob's Red Mill products in the past and was browsing through them to find a new hot breakfast cereal for winter. It cooks in two minutes - not quite instant but still quick on a busy weekday morn. I eat it with a little Grade B maple syrup (if you've only had Grade A, it's a must try) and it's delicious. Lots of fiber, creamy texture...I like it better than oatmeal.
title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

This is truly delicious; and it's quick and easy to prepare. I make it with water, almond milk, sugar, salt, cinnamon and vanilla. Then I top it with strawberries, raisins or slices of banana.

Text:
I know, oat bran doesn't sound appealing. Trust me, you'll like it. This stuff is creamy like grits, but has a lot of fiber.
I have it with maple syrup, pinch of salt, milk, walnuts, and raisins/fresh apples. Just throw everything into the microwave and heat until the milk bubbles up.
Note that as it cools, it will get thicker. So, experiment and add a bit more milk before heating to keep it runnier.

Better than oatmeal!

Summary: A delicious alternative to apple jacks
Text:
Sometimes, although almost heretical to say, I get tired of apple jacks every morning for breakfast. On those days, I'll usually turn to some form of oatmeal or cream of wheat. Organic oat bran is quite delicious. It reminds me of the days when we'd go to visit grandma and she'd have a hot bowl of mush for us (i think it was this stuff). Really good.

My wife doesn't like the steel cut oats because the texture is too lumpy. This oatmeal is much smoother and she loves it.

Text:
Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran hot cereal is my choice for a delicious and healthy breakfast. I like it because it has a low glycemic index and no artificial flavors or other chemicals. It is easy to cook (just add water and microwave) so it is perfect for a quick breakfast in the office. The price is pretty affordable especially with subscribe. One bag usually lasts me about 5 days.

Text:
The Amazon 4-pack comes packaged in the original Bob's box, put inside an amazon box for shipping.
The price is great. I could not find this item at my local grocers even though they carry other Bob's products. Amazon has everything! And great price, too. The oat bran is delicious. Creates a creamy hot cereal. Totally delicious with milk and a light dusting of brown sugar. I also tried the Dukan Diet pancakes made with greek yogurt and egg whites. I made the savory herb ones. They were wonderful...even my husband, who wasn't dieting, enjoyed them. Oat bran is also filling and keeps me full all morning. It has less calories than oatmeal...and more fiber. Great for digestive health! I particularly like that the bran is in small packages. I open and use one at a time. I feel like it stays fresher that way. I can also give them to friends and family to introduce them to the benefits of oat bran.
I highly recommend this product and buying it from Amazon.
title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Oat Bran Hot Cereal, 18 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)

Text: We are on our third shipment of this oatmeal - it is wonderful.  Even my husband,  who has disliked oatmeal all his life due to memories of the pasty stuff his mother used to make,  enjoys it.  I make our two servings on the stovetop - I think it comes out better this way.  I use a lot less water than called for.  For 2 servings I boil about 2 1/3 cups of water with a dash of salt,  then whisk in a heaping cup of oats and cook for two minutes. I thin it out in my bowl with a bit of milk and some brown sugar - yum! Fills us up for hours.

Text:
The flavor of these nuts is similar to cinnamon toast cereal, yet they are filling and healthy, containing little sugar and almost no salt. I would deduct a star for being priced too high both here and in the supermarket, but Blue Diamond deserves credit for their restraint in using quality ingredients and in not producing a sugar encrusted candy. Now if they would only go against the trend of charging a huge markup for minimal extra processing cost...

The other reviewer seems to think these contain lactose. The ingredients:
ALMONDS, EVAPORATED CANE JUICE, BROWN SUGAR, CORN MALTODEXTRIN, CINNAMON, NATURAL FLAVORS AND SALT. PEANUT FREE. MAY CONTAIN OTHER TREE NUTS. Unless OTHER TREE NUTS comes from cows, I don't think this is true.

Text:
Diamond Almonds
Almonds are a good source of magnesium. One ounce contain approximately 20% of the RDA for an adult recommended dietary allowance (RDA)
Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA) the amounts of selected nutrients considered adequate to meet the known nutrient needs of healthy people. The RDA is based on scientific knowledge and has been presented by a committee of the Food and Nutrition Board (FNB) of the National Academy of Sciences (NAS). The Canadian equivalent is the Recommended Nutrient Intakes. RDA is generally accepted throughout the world as a valid source of information. At least 40 different nations have as well as organizations have published standards similar to the RDA.

Magnesium is the fourth most abundant mineral in the body and is essential to good health. Approximately 50% of total body magnesium is found in bone. The other half is found predominantly inside cells of body tissues and organs. Only 1% of magnesium is found in blood, but the body works very hard to keep blood levels of magnesium constant.
Magnesium is needed for more than 300 biochemical reactions in the body. It helps maintain normal muscle and nerve function, keeps heart rhythm steady, supports a healthy immune system, and keeps bones strong. Magnesium also helps regulate blood sugar levels, promotes normal blood pressure, and is known to be involved in energy metabolism and protein synthesis. There is an increased interest in the role of magnesium in preventing and managing disorders such as hypertension, cardiovascular disease, and diabetes. Dietary magnesium is absorbed in the small intestines. Are you taking enough magnesium in the diet? The recommended daily allowance is 300mgs/day for men, 350mgs for women. Magnesium is extremely safe by mouth - too much simply causes diarrhea. Try increasing the amount of magnesium you take by mouth until it causes diarrhea, then reduce the dose slightly so it does not. This is called taking magnesium to bowel tolerance (just like using vitamin C to bowel tolerance.

Almonds are a good source of Fiber.
One ounce contains approximately 12% of the RDA for an adult.
So, in summary, Almonds are a very healthy snack, so what's left to say?

Two things:
1st be cautious about "bowel tolerance"" or ""happy bowels"" if you prefer.
2nd Taste. I realize that taste is a personal thing. That's why they make chocolate
asin:
and vanilla.

Here's my current favorites""

1st Blue Diamond Dark mint dark chocolate (reminds me of the chocolate mint Girl Scout Cookies with less sugar).

2nd Blue diamond Dark Chocolate Oven Roasted
3rd Blue diamond Blue Butter Toffee
4thd Blue Diamond Almonds Bold Habanero BBQ (reminds me of BBQ potato chips again with less sugar).
5th Bold Blazin Buffalo Wing
6th Blue Diamond Almonds Cinnamon Brown Sugar
7th Blue Diamond Almonds Lime `n Chili
8th Blue Diamond Almonds Smokehouse
9th Bold Wasabi & Soy Sauce

But that's just me: you might have a completely different take on these flavors.
4th and 5th are very close.

Gunner
May
listing_url: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

I will keep buying all their other flavors. The Bold line, especially the Habanero, is also excellent, as are the dark chocolate variety.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text: These almonds are nothing short of incredible- they are so delicious! If you are trying to follow a low-carb lifestyle (for dietary reasons or weight loss) and need a 'sweet fix' after meals, then this is a wonderful option - only 6 g. Net carbs! And the taste is so yummy! They are just sweet enough! I'm so glad that amazon sells them in bulk, because I could easily go through one container in a week!
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text: If you want a truly healthy, filling snack, you must give these a try, as well as their sisters, the Vanilla Bean Almonds. They are both just lightly sweetened, and fragrant with either the cinnamon or the vanilla, depending on which you choose. The container is marvelous; there is a half flip top which is easy to do with one hand (like in the car). And they're not roasted in more oil, so the almonds are "meaty"" and sweet. And almonds are SOOO good for you. I'd recommend that you try them
initial_identifier: and then get an Amazon subscribe and save if you can. It's well worth it! And all natural. LOVELY!"
title: B000ZT15EQ
brand: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Summary: Not the same as the canned version
Text: I expected that these canisters of Blue Diamond "Roasted Almonds - Honey"" would be the same product as the little cans of Blue Diamond ""Honey Roasted Almonds"" ( <a href=""http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000ZSZ5PW"">Blue Diamond Almonds Honey Roast
initial_identifier: 6-Ounce Tins (Pack of 12) ) but they're surprisingly not the same
asin: and have a very ""off"" taste.  What a disappointment!  Blue Diamond has apparently seen fit to add much more maltodextrin and ""other natural flavors""
title: which I suspect cause the odd taste
brand:
thus ruining a fabulous product.

I've been having a hard time finding the small cans of Blue Diamond ""Honey Roasted Almonds"" at the supermarkets
item_type_keyword: despite all the other flavors being carried.  It's as if Blue Diamond just
medium_image: *wants* this product to fail.  First they make it hard to get the canned version
product_type_name: then they completely change the taste of a great product and package it in a canister

Summary: Nice salt on a very dry nut.
Text: OK, I like a little richness. These nuts have a flavorful salt taste, but are almost too dry to get down your throat.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text: I love these almonds. They are my favorite to date and I would definitely buy again. The taste is crunchy, they are well toasted and the salt that has been added is just perfect. Not too little, not too much. Best I have ever eaten!!
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text:
This is basically candy masquerading as a "healthy"" snack. They taste good - because they have three different kinds of sugar in them! Blue Diamond wants you to think that eating sugar is a healthy snack - c'mon!

I purchased these thinking they were sweetened with stevia. Yeah
initial_identifier: there's a miniscule amount of stevia (very last ingredient) - but sugars are the 2nd
title: and 4th ingredient listed. These have corn maltodextrin - the worst thing there is on the glycemic index (can you say fat formation?). Now I'm stuck with 3 containers of this sugar snack."
listing_url: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text: These are the best tasting almonds. I buy them in bulk to share at work. Any time someone finds cheaper almonds, they always come back to these because they can't be beat.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text: I love these almonds!!  They taste just like a snickerdoodle cookie, but make for a much healthier snack!  One of my favorites of the Blue Diamond Oven Roasted varieties.  Buying them in a 6-pack is more cost-effective for me, especially now that I can't find them in my grocery store. I wish they came in the large resealable bag like some of the other flavors, but for now I'll stick with the 6 container pack.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text: I wouldn't call these almonds sweet, but they do have just the right hint of sweet flavor that the almond is elevated and feels like a treat.  The taste and texture of almonds doesn't particularly appeal to me, but they're such a healthy snack that I'm glad to find this delicious option.  Also, the small container is the perfect size to have on your desk or keep in the car, or use as stocking stuffers like I plan to do for a couple of my healthy eating conscious friends!
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Summary: You are only getting one container!
Text: I purchased 2 other types of Blue Diamond almonds on the same day, and they were both around $11 for a pack of 3. T his one was only ONE 8 oz. container, and I assumed it was at least 2-3 containers since the cost was over $8.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text: Nice sweet treat with some nutritional value. These are fantastic! The only thing is I can find them in more local store at a lower cost.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text: I LOVE the Blue Diamond Butter Toffee and The Chocolate.  This is my first try with the Cinnamon and they are fabulous!  I eat and live low carb and eat a lot of nuts...the flavored Blue Diamond Almonds are hard to find, so I am happy to find them on Amazon.  Even better to have them delivered to my door FAST & FREE!  Thanks Amazon and Blue Diamond!
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text:
I love salted and smoked almonds. I had never even heard of Butter Toffee almonds before. But, wow, I'm glad I tried them. They are just sweet enough to satisfy my sweet tooth without overwhelming you with a sugar taste.
Another reviewer was right, they taste a lot like french toast. I'm definately buying these again.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Summary: boy these are some tasty nuts !!
Text: Ive had some tasty nuts before but these are exceptionaly good. try them ! im very happy with this product
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Summary: Should almost be labelled a "BOLD"" flavor"
Text:
Butter Toffee is not a flavor I thought I would like - for some reason the name makes me think of an icky flavor. However, I became hooked at first bite. This flavor is much sweeter than the Honey Roasted. It certainly becomes my top "dessert almonds"" when in need of that sweet replacement.

Absolutely great for those on a low-carb or Keto diet - only 6 Net Carbs per serving. The bold
initial_identifier:
sweet flavor keeps you satisfied after only a small amount.

Highly recommended!"
title: B000ZT15EQ
brand: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text: These almonds are my favorite almonds.  Wal-Mart used to carry them, but now I have to order online.  They are the perfect balance of cinnamon and sugar without being overpoweringly sweet.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Summary: If You Like Almonds and You Like Cinnamon You will like these
Text:
The Almonds are very very fresh tasting. The cinnamon adds an extra bonus of goodness to the almonds with a great flavor. We keep them in the fridge. We also mix them with all the other nuts we have making our own nut mixture. Excellent snack with protein.

Just ordered some more of them.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text: I love these for a snack. I get a nice taste of chocolate and mint (in addition to the almond, of course), but it isn't super sweet. I hope Blue Diamond keeps coming out with more flavors. The Butter Toffee is great too.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Summary: A heathly snack we all love
Text: Great taste.  The Blue Diamond flavors are way better than the Emerald flavors.  Great between meals snack that we all eat.  Also grab to put in baggies for lunches.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text: After trying every kind of almond out there over the years, I will take these flavorful Blue Diamond almonds any day.  They are fresh, salted just right and not greasy/oily.  I try to eat a handful a day, usually as a mid-afternoon snack for optimum health benefits. The handy container is easy to use and even indicates portion size.  Unfortunately, this type of almonds is getting more and more difficult to find in my local stores, so I was happy to be able to order a 6-pack from Amazon to have in my pantry.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text: These are our absolute favorite almonds and love that there isn't any fake sugars in them.  I'll take more calories with real sweeteners any day over sucralose in the other brands. And this flavor is DELICIOUS.  YUM!
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text:
I ordered these lovely almonds a few weeks ago, as I often find myself jonesing for junk food, and I thought that if I had something that was good for me around, I would be less likely to grab something terrible. These nuts are packed with nutrition, and they taste amazing. They have just enough flavor to make me want more, but the fact that they are high in fat makes it difficult to eat too many in one sitting; I'm satiated with two handfuls. I go through one little container every week or so. They are perfect for anyone concerned with nutrition or trying to put on or keep muscle- they pack 6 grams of protein in 1 oz. I will definitely be re-purchasing these nuts. I wasn't so keen on the idea of the canisters, as I don't like producing so much waste, but I have purchased nuts (peanuts etc) in the past in bulk, and they did go bad before I finished eating them.
These nuts have kept me out of the icecream, chocolate chips, and other naughty sweet things that have little nutritional content. These nuts taste like they should be bad for you, but they are more similar to vitamins than junk food; read the back for the nutritional content: 35% Vitamin E, 15% Phosphorus, 20% Magnesium, 35% Manganese....the list goes on...:)

Update: I ordered my second shipment of these. I love these and I eat a handful of these almonds after my morning banana yogurt shake and with my vitamins :)
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text:
Diamond Almonds
Almonds are a good source of magnesium. One ounce contain approximately 20% of the RDA for an adult recommended dietary allowance (RDA)
Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA) the amounts of selected nutrients considered adequate to meet the known nutrient needs of healthy people. The RDA is based on scientific knowledge and has been presented by a committee of the Food and Nutrition Board (FNB) of the National Academy of Sciences (NAS). The Canadian equivalent is the Recommended Nutrient Intakes. RDA is generally accepted throughout the world as a valid source of information. At least 40 different nations have as well as organizations have published standards similar to the RDA.

Magnesium is the fourth most abundant mineral in the body and is essential to good health. Approximately 50% of total body magnesium is found in bone. The other half is found predominantly inside cells of body tissues and organs. Only 1% of magnesium is found in blood, but the body works very hard to keep blood levels of magnesium constant.
Magnesium is needed for more than 300 biochemical reactions in the body. It helps maintain normal muscle and nerve function, keeps heart rhythm steady, supports a healthy immune system, and keeps bones strong. Magnesium also helps regulate blood sugar levels, promotes normal blood pressure, and is known to be involved in energy metabolism and protein synthesis. There is an increased interest in the role of magnesium in preventing and managing disorders such as hypertension, cardiovascular disease, and diabetes. Dietary magnesium is absorbed in the small intestines. Are you taking enough magnesium in the diet? The recommended daily allowance is 300mgs/day for men, 350mgs for women. Magnesium is extremely safe by mouth - too much simply causes diarrhea. Try increasing the amount of magnesium you take by mouth until it causes diarrhea, then reduce the dose slightly so it does not. This is called taking magnesium to bowel tolerance (just like using vitamin C to bowel tolerance.

Almonds are a good source of Fiber.
One ounce contains approximately 12% of the RDA for an adult.
So, in summary, Almonds are a very healthy snack, so what's left to say?

Two things:
1st be cautious about "bowel tolerance"" or ""happy bowels"" if you prefer.
2nd Taste. I realize that taste is a personal thing. That's why they make chocolate
asin:
and vanilla.

Here's my current favorites""

1st Blue Diamond Dark mint dark chocolate (reminds me of the chocolate mint Girl Scout Cookies with less sugar).

2nd Blue diamond Dark Chocolate Oven Roasted
3rd Blue diamond Blue Butter Toffee
4thd Blue Diamond Almonds Bold Habanero BBQ (reminds me of BBQ potato chips again with less sugar).
5th Bold Blazin Buffalo Wing
6th Blue Diamond Almonds Cinnamon Brown Sugar
7th Blue Diamond Almonds Lime `n Chili
8th Blue Diamond Almonds Smokehouse
9th Bold Wasabi & Soy Sauce

But that's just me: you might have a completely different take on these flavors.
4th and 5th are very close.

Gunner
May
listing_url: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Too bad Amazon doesn't stock this, so no Free Shipping.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text: The almonds tastes all right. Since it is too dry, the salt can hardly stay on surface. Therefore, it is not salty enough. On the whole, it is a healthy snack. I hope this type of almonds can have subscription service and discount.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Summary: Butter Toffee almonds are sooo good, but hi-carb
Text:
I've tried several of the Blue Diamond jar almonds and the Butter Toffee almonds are the best. They would probably be my favorite almond, but they're high-carb. I guess the trick is to only eat a few at a time.... We can all do that, right? :-)

I agree with the other reviewer who said that the Blue Diamond almonds in the cans are better than the ones in the jars -- my favorite are the Vinegar & Salt -- but the Butter Toffee almonds are the exception.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text: It seems impossible that there is a healthy snack that tastes like cinnamon brown sugar but they've managed to do it.  I love these and I always have my cabinet stocked.  This quenches my sweet tooth without gulit.  I highly recommend it.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text: Do buy the almonds.  Great for snacks and travel.  The contanier has a close top which is great for storage.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text: Great flavor.  I snack on these when I need a boost of energy.  They help satisfy cravings between meals.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text: I must say, these almonds have made me a lover of nuts!!!  I have always been a cashew girl and never cared that much for almonds. Well, being on a low carb diet made cashews a no no.  Almonds roasted only with sea salt are soooo good. Blue Diamond makes the best tasting and these are hard to find in stores.  I love the 1 lb bag of these, but can't seem to find them. Buying these in bulk was the best deal out there and I will have to purchase again.  Thanks, Blue Diamond for a superior nut!
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Text:
So the hottest-hot-off-the-press recommendation is an ounce of almonds a day will help keep the doctor away.... and for good reason. They're full of B (and other) vitamins, fiber, --not-cholesterol, not-sodium, not-empty calories, and not tasteless wallpaper paste....

But these --- these new Blue Diamond almonds (I've so far tried both the Brown Sugar Cinnamon and the Vanilla -- are soooooo good that it's hard to stop at an ounce. This has become my after-dinner treat.

To help fight the sodium bugaboo, they've instead coated them with a velvet dairy whey based powder (take note, lactose-intolerant folks) that is loaded with flavor. They're not sweet -- except the sweetness of the lactose. And they're not the least bit salty. They taste like a great dessert in both flavor and texture.

Thumbs way up -- licking my fingers kind of up.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 6)

Magnesium is needed for more than 300 biochemical reactions in the body. It helps maintain normal muscle and nerve function, keeps heart rhythm steady, supports a healthy immune system, and keeps bones strong. Magnesium also helps regulate blood sugar levels, promotes normal blood pressure, and is known to be involved in energy metabolism and protein synthesis. There is an increased interest in the role of magnesium in preventing and managing disorders such as hypertension, cardiovascular disease, and diabetes. Dietary magnesium is absorbed in the small intestines. Are you taking enough magnesium in the diet? The recommended daily allowance is 300mgs/day for men, 350mgs for women. Magnesium is extremely safe by mouth - too much simply causes diarrhea. Try increasing the amount of magnesium you take by mouth until it causes diarrhea, then reduce the dose slightly so it does not. This is called taking magnesium to bowel tolerance (just like using vitamin C to bowel tolerance.

Almonds are a good source of Fiber.
One ounce contains approximately 12% of the RDA for an adult.
So, in summary, Almonds are a very healthy snack, so what's left to say?

Two things:
1st be cautious about "bowel tolerance"" or ""happy bowels"" if you prefer.
2nd Taste. I realize that taste is a personal thing. That's why they make chocolate
asin:
and vanilla.

Here's my current favorites""

1st Blue Diamond Dark mint dark chocolate (reminds me of the chocolate mint Girl Scout Cookies with less sugar).

2nd Blue diamond Dark Chocolate Oven Roasted
3rd Blue diamond Blue Butter Toffee
4thd Blue Diamond Almonds Bold Habanero BBQ (reminds me of BBQ potato chips again with less sugar).
5th Bold Blazin Buffalo Wing
6th Blue Diamond Almonds Cinnamon Brown Sugar
7th Blue Diamond Almonds Lime `n Chili
8th Blue Diamond Almonds Smokehouse
9th Bold Wasabi & Soy Sauce

But that's just me: you might have a completely different take on these flavors.
4th and 5th are very close.

Gunner

Text:
I order a package of 12 Chocolove Premium Chocolate Bars, which by the way is an excellent chocolate, but when it arrived the bars were bent and melting due to he heat of the delivery truck. I contacted the seller and without questions or argument I was sent another order. I received the order well packed and cold in 2 days. Because I was stunned to see such customer service I contacted the seller once again to offer payment for the UPS cost, but the seller refused stating that their goal is total satisfaction and that I should not pay for the shipping. Just amazing service! I will recommend this seller to anyone and ask to support them. If there were more stars to give I would had given them the max.
I hope this review helps.
DF

Text:
So, I do A/B tests. You know, like buy bar A and then bar B and then eat 'em both.

YEARS of doing this shamelessly has led me to become a regular purchaser of Chocolove's Pure Dark. The 55% one.

I don't care much for their other bars -- they're just so-so -- but DANG! the Pure Dark is crazy-good.

Do yourself a favor. Don't just buy this bar. Buy this bar and then buy ten other chocolate bars. It's in the name of science, it's okay. Take all your bars, break them up, then try them all.

Yeah, that chocolate that keeps evolving and coating your mouth with subtlety and wizardry? That's this one.

Text:
The flavor of these nuts is similar to cinnamon toast cereal, yet they are filling and healthy, containing little sugar and almost no salt. I would deduct a star for being priced too high both here and in the supermarket, but Blue Diamond deserves credit for their restraint in using quality ingredients and in not producing a sugar encrusted candy. Now if they would only go against the trend of charging a huge markup for minimal extra processing cost...

The other reviewer seems to think these contain lactose. The ingredients:
ALMONDS, EVAPORATED CANE JUICE, BROWN SUGAR, CORN MALTODEXTRIN, CINNAMON, NATURAL FLAVORS AND SALT. PEANUT FREE. MAY CONTAIN OTHER TREE NUTS. Unless OTHER TREE NUTS comes from cows, I don't think this is true.

Text:
Diamond Almonds
Almonds are a good source of magnesium. One ounce contain approximately 20% of the RDA for an adult recommended dietary allowance (RDA)
Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA) the amounts of selected nutrients considered adequate to meet the known nutrient needs of healthy people. The RDA is based on scientific knowledge and has been presented by a committee of the Food and Nutrition Board (FNB) of the National Academy of Sciences (NAS). The Canadian equivalent is the Recommended Nutrient Intakes. RDA is generally accepted throughout the world as a valid source of information. At least 40 different nations have as well as organizations have published standards similar to the RDA.

Magnesium is the fourth most abundant mineral in the body and is essential to good health. Approximately 50% of total body magnesium is found in bone. The other half is found predominantly inside cells of body tissues and organs. Only 1% of magnesium is found in blood, but the body works very hard to keep blood levels of magnesium constant.
Magnesium is needed for more than 300 biochemical reactions in the body. It helps maintain normal muscle and nerve function, keeps heart rhythm steady, supports a healthy immune system, and keeps bones strong. Magnesium also helps regulate blood sugar levels, promotes normal blood pressure, and is known to be involved in energy metabolism and protein synthesis. There is an increased interest in the role of magnesium in preventing and managing disorders such as hypertension, cardiovascular disease, and diabetes. Dietary magnesium is absorbed in the small intestines. Are you taking enough magnesium in the diet? The recommended daily allowance is 300mgs/day for men, 350mgs for women. Magnesium is extremely safe by mouth - too much simply causes diarrhea. Try increasing the amount of magnesium you take by mouth until it causes diarrhea, then reduce the dose slightly so it does not. This is called taking magnesium to bowel tolerance (just like using vitamin C to bowel tolerance.

Almonds are a good source of Fiber.
One ounce contains approximately 12% of the RDA for an adult.
So, in summary, Almonds are a very healthy snack, so what's left to say?

Two things:
1st be cautious about "bowel tolerance"" or ""happy bowels"" if you prefer.
2nd Taste. I realize that taste is a personal thing. That's why they make chocolate
asin:
and vanilla.

Here's my current favorites""

1st Blue Diamond Dark mint dark chocolate (reminds me of the chocolate mint Girl Scout Cookies with less sugar).

2nd Blue diamond Dark Chocolate Oven Roasted
3rd Blue diamond Blue Butter Toffee
4thd Blue Diamond Almonds Bold Habanero BBQ (reminds me of BBQ potato chips again with less sugar).
5th Bold Blazin Buffalo Wing
6th Blue Diamond Almonds Cinnamon Brown Sugar
7th Blue Diamond Almonds Lime `n Chili
8th Blue Diamond Almonds Smokehouse
9th Bold Wasabi & Soy Sauce

But that's just me: you might have a completely different take on these flavors.
4th and 5th are very close.

Gunner
