Text:
At first, I thought these tasted a little artificial. After a few handfuls I realized I like them, regardless.

I am a big fan of this company's products, and have even gone so far as to speak with one of their growers about the integrated pest management systems they employ (using the smallest amount of pesticides possible). I will keep buying all their other flavors. The Bold line, especially the Habanero, is also excellent, as are the dark chocolate variety.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Text: These almonds are nothing short of incredible- they are so delicious! If you are trying to follow a low-carb lifestyle (for dietary reasons or weight loss) and need a 'sweet fix' after meals, then this is a wonderful option - only 6 g. Net carbs! And the taste is so yummy! They are just sweet enough! I'm so glad that amazon sells them in bulk, because I could easily go through one container in a week!
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Text: If you want a truly healthy, filling snack, you must give these a try, as well as their sisters, the Vanilla Bean Almonds. They are both just lightly sweetened, and fragrant with either the cinnamon or the vanilla, depending on which you choose. The container is marvelous; there is a half flip top which is easy to do with one hand (like in the car). And they're not roasted in more oil, so the almonds are "meaty"" and sweet. And almonds are SOOO good for you. I'd recommend that you try them
initial_identifier: and then get an Amazon subscribe and save if you can. It's well worth it! And all natural. LOVELY!"
title: B0034KN29O
brand: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Summary: Not the same as the canned version
Text: I expected that these canisters of Blue Diamond "Roasted Almonds - Honey"" would be the same product as the little cans of Blue Diamond ""Honey Roasted Almonds"" ( <a href=""http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000ZSZ5PW"">Blue Diamond Almonds Honey Roast
initial_identifier: 6-Ounce Tins (Pack of 12) ) but they're surprisingly not the same
asin: and have a very ""off"" taste.  What a disappointment!  Blue Diamond has apparently seen fit to add much more maltodextrin and ""other natural flavors""
title: which I suspect cause the odd taste
brand:
thus ruining a fabulous product.

I've been having a hard time finding the small cans of Blue Diamond ""Honey Roasted Almonds"" at the supermarkets
item_type_keyword: despite all the other flavors being carried.  It's as if Blue Diamond just
medium_image: *wants* this product to fail.  First they make it hard to get the canned version
product_type_name: then they completely change the taste of a great product and package it in a canister

Summary: Nice salt on a very dry nut.
Text: OK, I like a little richness. These nuts have a flavorful salt taste, but are almost too dry to get down your throat.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Text: I love these almonds. They are my favorite to date and I would definitely buy again. The taste is crunchy, they are well toasted and the salt that has been added is just perfect. Not too little, not too much. Best I have ever eaten!!
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Text:
This is basically candy masquerading as a "healthy"" snack. They taste good - because they have three different kinds of sugar in them! Blue Diamond wants you to think that eating sugar is a healthy snack - c'mon!

I purchased these thinking they were sweetened with stevia. Yeah
initial_identifier: there's a miniscule amount of stevia (very last ingredient) - but sugars are the 2nd
title: and 4th ingredient listed. These have corn maltodextrin - the worst thing there is on the glycemic index (can you say fat formation?). Now I'm stuck with 3 containers of this sugar snack."
listing_url: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Text: These are the best tasting almonds. I buy them in bulk to share at work. Any time someone finds cheaper almonds, they always come back to these because they can't be beat.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Text: I love these almonds!!  They taste just like a snickerdoodle cookie, but make for a much healthier snack!  One of my favorites of the Blue Diamond Oven Roasted varieties.  Buying them in a 6-pack is more cost-effective for me, especially now that I can't find them in my grocery store. I wish they came in the large resealable bag like some of the other flavors, but for now I'll stick with the 6 container pack.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Text: I wouldn't call these almonds sweet, but they do have just the right hint of sweet flavor that the almond is elevated and feels like a treat.  The taste and texture of almonds doesn't particularly appeal to me, but they're such a healthy snack that I'm glad to find this delicious option.  Also, the small container is the perfect size to have on your desk or keep in the car, or use as stocking stuffers like I plan to do for a couple of my healthy eating conscious friends!
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Summary: You are only getting one container!
Text: I purchased 2 other types of Blue Diamond almonds on the same day, and they were both around $11 for a pack of 3. T his one was only ONE 8 oz. container, and I assumed it was at least 2-3 containers since the cost was over $8.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Text: Nice sweet treat with some nutritional value. These are fantastic! The only thing is I can find them in more local store at a lower cost.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Text: I LOVE the Blue Diamond Butter Toffee and The Chocolate.  This is my first try with the Cinnamon and they are fabulous!  I eat and live low carb and eat a lot of nuts...the flavored Blue Diamond Almonds are hard to find, so I am happy to find them on Amazon.  Even better to have them delivered to my door FAST & FREE!  Thanks Amazon and Blue Diamond!
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Text:
I love salted and smoked almonds. I had never even heard of Butter Toffee almonds before. But, wow, I'm glad I tried them. They are just sweet enough to satisfy my sweet tooth without overwhelming you with a sugar taste.
Another reviewer was right, they taste a lot like french toast. I'm definately buying these again.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Summary: boy these are some tasty nuts !!
Text: Ive had some tasty nuts before but these are exceptionaly good. try them ! im very happy with this product
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Summary: Should almost be labelled a "BOLD"" flavor"
Text:
Butter Toffee is not a flavor I thought I would like - for some reason the name makes me think of an icky flavor. However, I became hooked at first bite. This flavor is much sweeter than the Honey Roasted. It certainly becomes my top "dessert almonds"" when in need of that sweet replacement.

Absolutely great for those on a low-carb or Keto diet - only 6 Net Carbs per serving. The bold
initial_identifier:
sweet flavor keeps you satisfied after only a small amount.

Highly recommended!"
title: B0034KN29O
brand: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Text: These almonds are my favorite almonds.  Wal-Mart used to carry them, but now I have to order online.  They are the perfect balance of cinnamon and sugar without being overpoweringly sweet.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Summary: If You Like Almonds and You Like Cinnamon You will like these
Text:
The Almonds are very very fresh tasting. The cinnamon adds an extra bonus of goodness to the almonds with a great flavor. We keep them in the fridge. We also mix them with all the other nuts we have making our own nut mixture. Excellent snack with protein.

Just ordered some more of them.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Text: I love these for a snack. I get a nice taste of chocolate and mint (in addition to the almond, of course), but it isn't super sweet. I hope Blue Diamond keeps coming out with more flavors. The Butter Toffee is great too.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Summary: A heathly snack we all love
Text: Great taste.  The Blue Diamond flavors are way better than the Emerald flavors.  Great between meals snack that we all eat.  Also grab to put in baggies for lunches.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Text: After trying every kind of almond out there over the years, I will take these flavorful Blue Diamond almonds any day.  They are fresh, salted just right and not greasy/oily.  I try to eat a handful a day, usually as a mid-afternoon snack for optimum health benefits. The handy container is easy to use and even indicates portion size.  Unfortunately, this type of almonds is getting more and more difficult to find in my local stores, so I was happy to be able to order a 6-pack from Amazon to have in my pantry.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Text: These are our absolute favorite almonds and love that there isn't any fake sugars in them.  I'll take more calories with real sweeteners any day over sucralose in the other brands. And this flavor is DELICIOUS.  YUM!
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Text:
I ordered these lovely almonds a few weeks ago, as I often find myself jonesing for junk food, and I thought that if I had something that was good for me around, I would be less likely to grab something terrible. These nuts are packed with nutrition, and they taste amazing. They have just enough flavor to make me want more, but the fact that they are high in fat makes it difficult to eat too many in one sitting; I'm satiated with two handfuls. I go through one little container every week or so. They are perfect for anyone concerned with nutrition or trying to put on or keep muscle- they pack 6 grams of protein in 1 oz. I will definitely be re-purchasing these nuts. I wasn't so keen on the idea of the canisters, as I don't like producing so much waste, but I have purchased nuts (peanuts etc) in the past in bulk, and they did go bad before I finished eating them.
These nuts have kept me out of the icecream, chocolate chips, and other naughty sweet things that have little nutritional content. These nuts taste like they should be bad for you, but they are more similar to vitamins than junk food; read the back for the nutritional content: 35% Vitamin E, 15% Phosphorus, 20% Magnesium, 35% Manganese....the list goes on...:)

Update: I ordered my second shipment of these. I love these and I eat a handful of these almonds after my morning banana yogurt shake and with my vitamins :)
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Text:
Diamond Almonds
Almonds are a good source of magnesium. One ounce contain approximately 20% of the RDA for an adult recommended dietary allowance (RDA)
Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA) the amounts of selected nutrients considered adequate to meet the known nutrient needs of healthy people. The RDA is based on scientific knowledge and has been presented by a committee of the Food and Nutrition Board (FNB) of the National Academy of Sciences (NAS). The Canadian equivalent is the Recommended Nutrient Intakes. RDA is generally accepted throughout the world as a valid source of information. At least 40 different nations have as well as organizations have published standards similar to the RDA.

Magnesium is the fourth most abundant mineral in the body and is essential to good health. Approximately 50% of total body magnesium is found in bone. The other half is found predominantly inside cells of body tissues and organs. Only 1% of magnesium is found in blood, but the body works very hard to keep blood levels of magnesium constant.
Magnesium is needed for more than 300 biochemical reactions in the body. It helps maintain normal muscle and nerve function, keeps heart rhythm steady, supports a healthy immune system, and keeps bones strong. Magnesium also helps regulate blood sugar levels, promotes normal blood pressure, and is known to be involved in energy metabolism and protein synthesis. There is an increased interest in the role of magnesium in preventing and managing disorders such as hypertension, cardiovascular disease, and diabetes. Dietary magnesium is absorbed in the small intestines. Are you taking enough magnesium in the diet? The recommended daily allowance is 300mgs/day for men, 350mgs for women. Magnesium is extremely safe by mouth - too much simply causes diarrhea. Try increasing the amount of magnesium you take by mouth until it causes diarrhea, then reduce the dose slightly so it does not. This is called taking magnesium to bowel tolerance (just like using vitamin C to bowel tolerance.

Almonds are a good source of Fiber.
One ounce contains approximately 12% of the RDA for an adult.
So, in summary, Almonds are a very healthy snack, so what's left to say?

Two things:
1st be cautious about "bowel tolerance"" or ""happy bowels"" if you prefer.
2nd Taste. I realize that taste is a personal thing. That's why they make chocolate
asin:
and vanilla.

Here's my current favorites""

1st Blue Diamond Dark mint dark chocolate (reminds me of the chocolate mint Girl Scout Cookies with less sugar).

2nd Blue diamond Dark Chocolate Oven Roasted
3rd Blue diamond Blue Butter Toffee
4thd Blue Diamond Almonds Bold Habanero BBQ (reminds me of BBQ potato chips again with less sugar).
5th Bold Blazin Buffalo Wing
6th Blue Diamond Almonds Cinnamon Brown Sugar
7th Blue Diamond Almonds Lime `n Chili
8th Blue Diamond Almonds Smokehouse
9th Bold Wasabi & Soy Sauce

But that's just me: you might have a completely different take on these flavors.
4th and 5th are very close.

Gunner
May
listing_url: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

I've tried several of the Blue Diamond jar almonds and the Butter Toffee almonds are the best. They would probably be my favorite almond, but they're high-carb. I guess the trick is to only eat a few at a time.... We can all do that, right? :-)

I agree with the other reviewer who said that the Blue Diamond almonds in the cans are better than the ones in the jars -- my favorite are the Vinegar & Salt -- but the Butter Toffee almonds are the exception.

title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

Text:
So the hottest-hot-off-the-press recommendation is an ounce of almonds a day will help keep the doctor away.... and for good reason. They're full of B (and other) vitamins, fiber, --not-cholesterol, not-sodium, not-empty calories, and not tasteless wallpaper paste....

But these --- these new Blue Diamond almonds (I've so far tried both the Brown Sugar Cinnamon and the Vanilla -- are soooooo good that it's hard to stop at an ounce. This has become my after-dinner treat.

To help fight the sodium bugaboo, they've instead coated them with a velvet dairy whey based powder (take note, lactose-intolerant folks) that is loaded with flavor. They're not sweet -- except the sweetness of the lactose. And they're not the least bit salty. They taste like a great dessert in both flavor and texture.

Thumbs way up -- licking my fingers kind of up.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Honey, 8-ounce container

1st Blue Diamond Dark mint dark chocolate (reminds me of the chocolate mint Girl Scout Cookies with less sugar).

2nd Blue diamond Dark Chocolate Oven Roasted
3rd Blue diamond Blue Butter Toffee
4thd Blue Diamond Almonds Bold Habanero BBQ (reminds me of BBQ potato chips again with less sugar).
5th Bold Blazin Buffalo Wing
6th Blue Diamond Almonds Cinnamon Brown Sugar
7th Blue Diamond Almonds Lime `n Chili
8th Blue Diamond Almonds Smokehouse
9th Bold Wasabi & Soy Sauce

But that's just me: you might have a completely different take on these flavors.
4th and 5th are very close.

Gunner
May

Summary: Hands down best popcorn you can get outside of a theater
Text:
I often wonder if I am the only person in the world who cannot stand microwave popcorn. Give me real corn and a little oil and I am pretty happy. Then I discovered this popcorn at a kitchen store in my local outlet. Then they went out of business and I lost my awesome popcorn connection... until now.

Wabash Valley Farms is the best popcorn you can get outside of your local multi-plex (though I really like target popcorn too). You don't need the whirly popper as indicated on the package instructions - I always cook it on the stovetop in a large covered pot; my sister cooks it in one of those fancy carnival poppers.

Each pack contains 5 pouches of product. Each pouch contains popping oil, popcorn, and a buttery salt topping (which I only use about half of - it is very fine and very salty). For those that like additional butter, you can add it after popping. While I cannot attest to the exact amount of popcorn yielded, it does do a good job of filling up my 32-cup Tupperware Thatsa bowl. Thatsalotta popcorn.

The unit cost is $1.66 per pouch, which may seem high when comparing it to microwave popping corn, but you just cannot compare the quality and taste (and when compared to theater popcorn, it is a fraction of the cost). Orville Redenbacher has nothing on Wabash!
title: Wabash Valley Farms All Inclusive Popping Kits - Real Theater Popcorn - 5 Kit - 3 Pack

Text: Taste just like the movies. Just add your own butter. No extra salt needed. Absolutely delicious. Unfortunately it went from five packs to three packs. I am not sure it's really worth it now.
title: Wabash Valley Farms All Inclusive Popping Kits - Real Theater Popcorn - 5 Kit - 3 Pack

Text: Delicious popcorn!  Doesn't take any longer to make than a standard microwave popcorn, but much more flavorful!  If you love fresh popcorn, this is the way to go!
title: Wabash Valley Farms All Inclusive Popping Kits - Real Theater Popcorn - 5 Kit - 3 Pack

Text:
It is nice to have it all in one place. The corn is nice. The grease tastes good. It comes with seasoning (orange salt). It is all together and easy.

The only problem is that it is a little on the expensive side and takes up a little more room.
title: Wabash Valley Farms All Inclusive Popping Kits - Real Theater Popcorn - 5 Kit - 3 Pack

Summary: Nothing comes closer to movie theater popcorn
Text: We ate microwave popcorn for years.  Then I decided to try this.  Wow!  It is really like eating popcorn from the movie theater.  We will still use microwave popcorn for convenience every so often.
title: Wabash Valley Farms All Inclusive Popping Kits - Real Theater Popcorn - 5 Kit - 3 Pack

Text: Yum, Yum, Yum, Yum...  (Munch, munch).  Yum!  Love it and it tastes wonderful.  Works perfect in a whirly-popcorn maker.  They best compliment is when the kids ask, can we make another batch, and they like it better than the movie.  Our friends have tried it and have asked for what we use as our popcorn recipe.  How cool is that!?
title: Wabash Valley Farms All Inclusive Popping Kits - Real Theater Popcorn - 5 Kit - 3 Pack

Text: Great popcorn!  I'm a repeat buyer too.  One pack makes just a teeny bit more than my Whirly Pop can hold with the lid closed.  The kernels pop big and have a great flavor.  The hulls are farely tame for big kernels. My only suggestion for Wabash Valley Farms would be to boost the butter flavor just a smidge.  Maybe I'm old fashioned but popcorn popped on the stove top is so much better than microwaved.
title: Wabash Valley Farms All Inclusive Popping Kits - Real Theater Popcorn - 5 Kit - 3 Pack

Easy to make and surprisingly good, far better than any microwave popcorn and I have tried many brands.  You can make this in a large cooking pot with a lid.  They suggest you use something called a "Whirly Pop Popper"" but its not necessary to buy that.  I have a gas stove

Text:
I order a package of 12 Chocolove Premium Chocolate Bars, which by the way is an excellent chocolate, but when it arrived the bars were bent and melting due to he heat of the delivery truck. I contacted the seller and without questions or argument I was sent another order. I received the order well packed and cold in 2 days. Because I was stunned to see such customer service I contacted the seller once again to offer payment for the UPS cost, but the seller refused stating that their goal is total satisfaction and that I should not pay for the shipping. Just amazing service! I will recommend this seller to anyone and ask to support them. If there were more stars to give I would had given them the max.
I hope this review helps.
DF

Summary: The best chocolate bar, hands down
Text:
I love chocolate. Good chocolate. I've tried fancy bars, local bars, hand-poured bars, organic bars, and almost everything else, and THIS is my favorite. The chocolate is perfectly dark without being bitter, the orange has an incredibly satisfying crunch and a slight (very slight) chewiness that makes the texture of the bar divine, and the flavor of orange and chocolate together are heavenly.

If only they sold it in more places!

Text:
So, I do A/B tests. You know, like buy bar A and then bar B and then eat 'em both.

YEARS of doing this shamelessly has led me to become a regular purchaser of Chocolove's Pure Dark. The 55% one.

I don't care much for their other bars -- they're just so-so -- but DANG! the Pure Dark is crazy-good.

Do yourself a favor. Don't just buy this bar. Buy this bar and then buy ten other chocolate bars. It's in the name of science, it's okay. Take all your bars, break them up, then try them all.

Yeah, that chocolate that keeps evolving and coating your mouth with subtlety and wizardry? That's this one.
title: Chocolove Chocolate Bar, 55% Dark, 3.2 Ounce (Pack of 12)

Summary: Maple sugar is wonderful in breads
Text:
This is a great price for this.
I love baking with maple sugar, and sometimes I'll have it in my coffee as well. My favorite use of this wonderful tasting sugar is in shortbread made with whole wheat flour. The flavor stands up well to the stronger flavor of whole wheat and makes just the best shortbread I've ever had. I've also used it in breads. It's more expensive than brown sugar, but the maple taste of pure maple sugar can't be simulated.
It's also good in oatmeal, granola recipes, and most anywhere you would use regular sugar or brown sugar.

Text: I started eating this granola during a stent where I was eating foods without additives. I pretty much though I didn't like granola, but needed a snack and decided to give it a try. As other people have said, it is very fresh and the consistency is super, not hard, like most granolas. This makes the best yogurt parfaits. It's also good enough to just eat it alone, and you can't say that for the vast majority of granola. What's best about it though, is that it is actually healthy because all of the calories and nutritional content are from whole grains, nuts, and honey, not from other additional stuff whose only purpose I've found is to make the granola hard and not taste fresh. You will not go wrong buying this, trust me! My Fresh Market stopped selling their brand and I came on Amazon to see if I could buy it online and decided to write a review because I love it that much. It's that good.

We can thank food manufacturers like Crunchmaster for that difficulty. With the following proudly printed across the front of the package: "Certified Gluten Free!""

so it's not..."".

Summary: This Popcorn treat is worth the money!

Text: We have enjoyed the 60% as an after dinner snack too for several years.  And I think they do well in baking.  BUT - as of a month ago,they started to taste different! ProfileName: Charles Barnard "Time taken planning SAVES TI..."
Summary: Taste is a very personal matter
Text:
I quite buying any chocolate which doesn't state the cacao percentage on the label some time ago--and have been lobbying the FDA to make such labeling a requirement.

I settled on the Ghirardelli 72% chips a couple years ago as my optimal balance between quality, flavor and cost--chips are always considerably less expensive than bar candy.

I sit with a bag of the 60% cacao bittersweet on my desk as I write. I was forced to switch to this from the 72% when it became impossible to find the 72% locally (on my income, price is always important!)

These are smooth, melt evenly and have a nice chocolate flavor without any significant other notes I can detect (your tastes may vary!)

Americans have a problem with 'bitter' flavors--few US dishes use the bitter taste at all, and most Americans seem to feel that bitter equates to bad. Well, unsweetened cocoa is bitter, and it stays that way until you get to a fairly high level of added sweet.

This means that high cocoa content chocolate is a taste that must be cultivated to some extent--how many coffee drinkers out there truly enjoyed their first cup? (Regular drinkers are addicted...enjoyment may come second to getting their fix.)

My cookie recipe is based upon the Joy Of Cooking recipe, which I double everything EXCEPT the chocolate ships, and add 1/8 tsp red pepper (ground) and 1/4 tsp orange or lemon extract. These chips work quite well (though short of burning them, it's pretty hard to make a chocolate based dessert which I'd not eat...I even carried the infamous 'desert bars' for a few months in my car--slightly chocolate flavored wax is better than no chocolate at all....)

For several months I went through 4-5 bags of these a week as snacks.

The best chocolate is the one you personally like best. After that, it comes down to the recipe it is being used to make.

These are better than average bittersweet chips which can be found in grocery stores at a considerable savings compared with any online vendor I've managed to find.
title: Ghirardelli Baking Chips, 60% Bittersweet Chocolate, 10 oz

Text:
Warning: you will never go back to Nestle or any other so called chocolate after getting used to these. Very chocolaty and not too sweet.

Costco carries the very similar Ghirardelli Double Chocolate Bittersweet chips for way less then here. (3.5 lb bag for under [...].) But only during "baking season"" (Nov through early January). (Must we adhere to ""baking season""?)

The food faddists are saying chocolate is good for you. Enjoy now before it all changes again."
title: Ghirardelli Baking Chips, 60% Bittersweet Chocolate, 10 oz

Text: These are the best grocery store chocolate chips out there.  If you are a true chocoholic, I have no doubt that you'll love Ghiradelli's chocolate chips, in all their flavors, especially if you like to nibble on them straight from the bag.  Someone mentioned that they had trouble with their baking when using these.  All I have to say is this, I've used them and won county fair baking competitions.  I don't think they negatively influence my baking; they enhance it!  If you think of the difference between milk chocolate chips and semisweet, it's about the same difference between semisweet and bittersweet.  (To me, anyway.)  :)  Enjoy!
title: Ghirardelli Baking Chips, 60% Bittersweet Chocolate, 10 oz

Text:
I am in love with these chocolate chips. Hands down the best chocolate chip on the market. I eat them out of bag, in oatmeal chocolate ships, as a dipping chocolate, in brownies... The list goes on and on. They are not too sweet, are creamy and smooth, and have an AMAZING chocolate taste. I used to buy them from the grocery store, but they recently stopped carrying them. I am so thankful that Amazon carries them so I won't have to go through withdrawals. ;)

Oh, and they arrive in PERFECT condition. Ghirardelli obviously knows chocolate. I ordered 5 bags and they came expertly packaged in a lined box, with frozen gel packs. The packs were still frozen and the chocolate was cool. Absolutely amazing. I stood there in awe for a minute before calling my boyfriend over to check out the packaging. We are both very impressed and will reuse the gel packs to keep our food cool when we hike.
title: Ghirardelli Baking Chips, 60% Bittersweet Chocolate, 10 oz

Text: I grew up on Nestlé Toll House Chocolate Chip cookies - my mother's recipe, a slight variation on the Nestlé Toll House recipe, and I thought nothing could ever beat them. But I made ATK's best chocolate chip cookie recipe with these Ghirardeli bittersweet chips and after the first cookie, I thought, what's so special about these? After the second, they WERE suddenly the best. I've made variations to the recipe since then; I make double batches and freeze them and am able to have them every day. It's the chip that makes the cookie and I'll never go back to Nestlé chips for baking chocolate chip cookies. I do prefer dark chocolate to milk chocolate and the bad reviews are comparing semi-sweet to bittersweet so that could be a reason for not liking them.

Text: I've been using this product since the early '70's, and when it disappears from the grocer's shelves I get upset as a baby who wants his pablum! I'm glad it's available online. Buckwheat is closest to animal protein of all the grains, and the grain in its various forms has been a staple in Europe and Asia. The cereal cooks quickly and can be used in a variety of recipes. Best of all, it's a tasty alternative to wheat, oats and rice. You've probably had kasha, made from the roasted groats which have a strong, nutty flavor. Cream of buckwheat is bland, I mean good-bland, because it won't turn off the kids and lends itself to various sweeteners. Though it's not shown on the Cream of Buckwheat box, it works as an "instant"" bowl of hot cereal: Follow the measuring directions for a single serving
initial_identifier: put in a microwaveable cereal bowl 1/4 c. cereal to 1 1/4 c. water. Microwave on MEDIUM (I use power # 6 or 7 of 10) for 4 min.
asin: interrupting once or twice to stir. Important: Do not cook on high
title: or the mixture will boil over! If you need to cook longer than 4 min.
brand: make sure you reset the power for medium. If desired
item_type_keyword: add milk (I use soy) and sweeten (I like maple syrup)."

Like most people, I don't have a lot of time in the morning to cook breakfast during the week. So, I make a big pot of this cereal on the weekend and store the leftovers in the refrigerator. I add a little vanilla after the cereal has been cooked. Bourbon vanilla compliments this cereal well.

I reheat the cereal in the microwave for 1 1/2 minutes. Then, I sprinkle on a little cinnamon and add a sliced banana. It fills me up. Also, this cereal is tasty plain.

I purchased this at Whole Foods for $3.63 (and received 10% off because I purchased the case). Most grocery stores will order this for you--and give you 10% off the case price. Usually Amazon's prices beat Whole Foods, but not in this instance.

I originally purchased this for the two celiacs in my household (we are 100% gluten-free kitchen) but ended up using it as one of the few foods I could eat when I had a gall-bladder attack (no dairy with it, just added a TB of hemp oil after cooking and a slight drizzle of maple syrup.

To make grits I follow directions for water exactly. For hot cereal, I add a bit more water.
title: Pocono Cream of Buckwheat, 100% Organic Cereal. 13-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)

Text: I love the organic Cream of Buckwheat.  It makes an absolutely perfect, gluten-free, protein/carb balanced filling breakfast.  I make it with 1 cup Silk Pure coconut milk (80 cals, 45% DV calcium, 24% DV Vitamin D), 1/4 - 1/2 cup water and 1/4 cup buckwheat, bring to a boil and let it simmer 10 minutes.  Stir in "warm"" spices (I use a mix of cinnamon
title: tumeric for its anti-inflammatory properties
brand: cloves) and it's absolutely lovely.  The coconut milk is sweet enough (6 g sugar) that - for my taste - it doesn't need for agave
listing_url: or other sweeteners...and I have a huge sweet tooth.  Sometimes I'll add fruit (banana

Text:
This cereal makes a hearty and satisfying breakfast. In my opinion, it has a better flavor than plain old oatmeal and it's wheat and gluten free, which is a bonus for people who need to avoid wheat or gluten products or who are on a low-glycemic index diet such as South Beach.

I like the versatility of the cereal - you can easily flavor it to be sweet like oatmeal or savory like grits and it's delicious either way. Also, I always try to eat organic when possible, so the fact that it's organic is an extra bonus!
title: Pocono Cream of Buckwheat, 100% Organic Cereal. 13-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)

Text:
I am gluten free (and have other allergies) and I use this as a hot cereal. I do cook it in the microwave sometimes. I have actually used it mostly as a savory cereal - with sausage. Sometimes i mix it with corn grits.

Recently i've also put it in a multigrain slow rise gluten free bread, and it was really good. I havent liked the flavor of buckwheat flour, but I love the flavor of this buckwheat cereal.
title: Pocono Cream of Buckwheat, 100% Organic Cereal. 13-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)

Text: I'm a repeat customer. After the success I had with the first round of fortune cookies last year, I decided to order more cookies for the night of the Opening Ceremonies of the Olympics. A representative of Greenfire and I worked together and came up with 60 different Olympics-related fortunes and I ordered three pounds of them. My staff loved them. I brought them to a meeting at the start of the day, and we spent almost as much time reading the fortunes to each other as we spent working. After the meeting, I left them out for the staff go nibble away at, and by the end of the night, all three pounds were gone. I got a kick out of hearing my staff laughing at the fortunes we came up with. Two successful rounds of fortunes, and I plan on being back for a third round.
title: Greenfire Custom Fortune Cookies, for Special Events and Occasions, Full Color Fortune Printing, Premium Vanilla, Bulk Quantity (300)

Summary: good smooth cookie with a little kick
Text:
I found this vanilla flavor to be the smoothest flavor for all the Java Bites cookies. If you're looking for a raw Java punch this flavor is not for you. If you want a more refined flavor between smooth, sweet, and twist you should consider these cookies.

I really enjoyed eating these cookies. These cookies are crisp which would allow you to dunk them in milk if you prefer or eat them plain. Their flavor is a nice combination between sweet and coffee. Imagine coffee ice cream and now translate that flavor into a cookie without the creamy flavor of ice cream. Maybe a better analogy would be chocolate covered espresso beans without such a strong chocolate or coffee flavor. I found there a nice pick me up when I was looking for something sweet with a little bit of a boost.

I consider these a special treat that this appears way too fast.
title: Java Bites Espresso Cookies, White Chocolate Vanilla Latte, 5.25-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 4)

Summary: Coffee, Chocolate, Cookies... WHAT'S NOT TO LIKE?!
Text:
If you like coffee, chocolate & crunchy cookies, I can give you my personal guarantee that YOU WILL LOVE THESE COOKIES!

In 2004 I introduced a new cookie concept that was really my husband David's idea. Responding to requests to add cookies to our line-up of wholesale coffee shop desserts, I decided on a cookie that could be dipped in coffee (but not like biscotti). David jokingly suggested, "why don't you just put the coffee into the cookie instead of dunking the cookie into the coffee?"" Mmmm
asin:
I thought.

But this proved to be easier said than done. The most challenging part was to get that ""just dipped in a latte"" flavor
title: that has now become our hallmark. Coffee flavoring was just too bitter. 14 months of experimenting later
brand:
I formulated a specially designed wet cookie dough that would allow coarsely ground espresso beans to actually ""brew"" into the cookies as they slowly baked. Finally! A chocolate chip cookie that truly tastes like you dunked it in a freshly brewed cup of French Roast coffee... soon named ""The Chocolate Chip Espresso"".

I then added different flavors to eventually produce a line of cookies that reads like the menu board in your favorite coffee shop:

""White Chocolate Vanilla Latte"". Our signature cookie & best seller
listing_url:
REAL white chocolate pieces & bits of espresso beans.
White Chocolate Vanilla Latte
medium_image:
5.25 ounce boxes (pack of 4 boxes)
or White Chocolate Vanilla Latte

For those of you who love Twinings Four Red Fruits, there is a reason why Four Red Fruits has been disappearing from store shelves. Twinings has recently changed this tea's name and packaging. Summary: A Four Red Fruits Tea rocks
Text: Four red fruits tea adds a wonderful berry flavor to our iced tea.  I get a gallon of warm water from the tap, put in 2 family sized decaf tea bags, plus a 4 Red Fruits, 2 Peach, & a Blackberry.  Stick it in the fridge and a few hours later -- Yummy tea!!!
title: Twinings Mixed Berry Tea, Tea Bags, 20-Count Boxes (Pack of 6)

Text: I did not actually buy this tea from amazon, but I had to write about my love for it somewhere!  This is my new favorite morning tea.  The smell is simply DIVINE.  The berry does come through in taste, and the scent while putting the tea mug to your lips enhances the experience.  I try to steep it for about 5~7 minutes for a 16oz mug... although when I forget to take the teabag out, it really does not seem to get bitter at all (as many black teas do).  I drink it without sugar or milk (milk will negate the antioxidants in tea!) and it is neither bitter nor sweet.  The best way to get great flavor with black teas is to use BOILING water, not just hot.  Caffeine content is about what black tea should be: a little less than half a cup of coffee-- enough that I can drink 3 or 4 cups and not feel my eye twitching at the end of the day.  Really, I have quite a few kinds of tea in my cupboard and none of them match this one!  After trying this tea, I went back and bought three more boxes.  Will probably use amazon to order it in bulk sometime soon.  Enjoy!!!
title: Twinings Mixed Berry Tea, Tea Bags, 20-Count Boxes (Pack of 6)

Summary: Black tea at its finest with a fresh fruit taste.

Summary: a mix that is better than homemade
Text: Betty Crocker Cherry Chip Cake mix is so amazing.  The cherry flavor is sweetly defined but subtle at the same time.  It cooks up so moist.  If making a layered round cake try using Betty Crocker's cherry frosting for the between layers filling and the cream cheese frosting on the top and sides.  If making a sheet cake, I suggest mixing the cherry and cream cheese frosting together and apply as thick top layer... using your electric mixer to blend the two will not only create a uniquely delicious flavor but will make your frosting so light and airy.  This store bought cake mix and frostings creates a better than homemade cake.
title: Betty Crocker Supermoist Cake Mix, Cherry Chip, 18.25-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)

Text: Wow, I guess I didn't realize that Betty Crocker Cherry Chip cake mixes were so hard to come by.  Our local stores in MI, still carry this flavor.  I was able to take advantage of a sale using coupons and got them for 25 cents a box at one store and free a week later at another store.....They are so delightfully delicious but I use a chocolate frosting on the cherry chip cakes to give it sort of a Black Forest type flavor.  I also use a whipped white frosting and add 2 teaspoons of almond extract to it, blend well, and frost my cherry chip cake with that for another awesome flavor variety. A third kids favorite is to frost the cake with a whipped white frosting that has a half pack of unsweetened cherry flavored Kool-Aid beaten in plus a few drops of red food coloring to make it pinkish in color.  I hope all these ideas are helpful.
title: Betty Crocker Supermoist Cake Mix, Cherry Chip, 18.25-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)

Summary: This stuff is really good, but expensive...
Text:
This stuff is one of my favorite cereals. It tastes good, it's full of fiber, little bit of sugar. It also DOESN'T contain lots of refined white flour and other stuff that gums up the works like most cereals.

If you need a good source of tasty fiber, but not the caked on white sugar like Frosted mini wheats, this is the good stuff.

But darn if it's not one of the more expensive cereals out there. Can't seem to find it for less than $4/box locally. Why is it so expensive? WinCo used to have it on sale for like $1.99, but then jacked up the prices. Not fair.

Summary: You CAN make hemp milk too!
Text:
I decided to start making my own hemp milk. My boys are allergic to wheat/gluten, dairy/beef, eggs/chicken, shellfish, peanuts, soy, corn, sesame, mushrooms, maple, oranges and cinnamon so they are very restricted vegans eating a high raw and organic diet. Hemp is wonderful for protein, omegas, and healthy fats!

At first I had subscribed and saved to this 8 oz (pack of 3) organic hempseed for $16.75. I bought 10 (30 packs) to start. That's about 70 cents per ounce. I like the portable packs for traveling, visiting grandparents, snacking out of. An ounce is 3 TBSP which is one serving.

I bought quarts of commercial hemp milk for years, Manitoba Harvest, Living Harvest and Pacific (Pacific Vanilla was our favorite.) I did the Amazon s/s program. But when I bought my Blendtec Wildside blender I started thinking "I CAN MAKE IT MYSELF!""

Here's what you need:
a high performance blender like VitaMix or Blendtec is best
Shelled hempseed
initial_identifier:
8 ounces
purified water
a nut milk bag for straining (sold on Amazon for $8)
a sweetener like honey
title: dates
brand:
or brown rice syrup
vanilla if you like
Real salt or sea salt of high quality
two 78 ounce frigoverre glass jars with tight sealing hermetic lids (sold on Amazon for $10-15) or equivalent

Make 1 gallon of hemp milk by adding 1 quart of pure water and the an entire 8 oz package shelled hempseed to a blender bowl and blend on medium about 2 minutes (soaking 15 minutes first is optional). Line the inside of one of the jars with the nut milk bag (hold the bag so it won't fall in) and pour the cream into the bag. Squeeze it through the nut milk bag into one of the jars
listing_url: then pour the strained cream back into the blender.  I added 1 teaspoon Real Salt

Summary: Nutiva HempSeed is very very good...
Text: I heard my friend who is a fan of Rocky Mountain say that Nutiva had too many shell pieces in it.  But I tried it anyway, and it doesn't, I think it is the better product though really there isn't a lot of difference in any of the products I tried.  Thing is, 3 bags of Nutiva is a bucket and a half of Rocky Mountain's......so if you buy in 2's like I do, then for $36 or $37 you get 3 buckets worth.  With Rocky, you get 2 buckets for $32 or $33, so the extra bucket is like, only $5.....what I also found was that the packets they send them in are very good/well resealable....so I keep them so I can put about 7 or 8 tablespoon full in one bag, cause it fits so well in my briefcase to take to work, and the spoon fit wholly inside the package too!  It is really convienient.  Anyway....thats it.....=)  Free shipping too....
title: Nutiva Organic, Raw, Shelled Hempseed , 8-ounce (Pack of 3)

Summary: We need some fat, but not a lot - hemp is a good one!
Text:
Hemp seeds have a good balance of EFA's that our body needs to consume. It is a source of fat that we can consume in small quantities to get nutrients that are not available in fruit, greens and vegetables.

I eat according to a low-fat vegan lifestyle consuming mostly fruit, greens and some other vegetables. I do have small amounts of fat in the form of nuts, seeds or avocado. I only have about 2 oz a daily (not always every day) as you get some fats even in your fruit and greens and we don't need lots of it for sustenance.

To learn more about this lifestyle that I ascribe to, check
out 80/10/10 by Dr. Doug Graham and also The China Study by
T. Colin Campbell.

If you are struggling with your health, only you can make a difference. The doctors can't heal you, nor the medicines or even the food (it does have benefits to creating homeostasis in the body) - ultimately, YOU HEAL YOURSELF!
title: Nutiva Organic, Raw, Shelled Hempseed , 8-ounce (Pack of 3)

Text: Hempseed is a great summplement to my diet.  It's much easier to take than flax seed and it taste good too.  Nutiva is Ok for the price, but I would have to say Manitoba is much better but you pay for it.  I've found in the Nutiva some of the shells are still on the on seeds and the taste is not as fresh or nutty as others.  When buying hempseeds I generally buy Manitoba, but when it comes time to restocking I sometimes get lured by the price of Nutiva.  Nutiva isn't bad, it's pretty good and if you haven't tried Manitoba then you wouldn't even know any better!

Text: I love these.  They are a great change from flax especially if you want to just sprinkle them on salad, cereal, etc.  I find flax is best when freshly ground.  Hemp is great just out of the bag.
title: Nutiva Organic, Raw, Shelled Hempseed , 8-ounce (Pack of 3)

Text:
I heard about the benefits of hemp and ordered this pack. The seeds came right away and were much smaller than I had thought they'd be. Each seed is about double the size of pinhead. I've found that they're not something you can really snack on without a spoon handy. However, they have a great nutty flavor that's a bit difficult to describe, a little like pinenuts but with a touch of the skunky flavor that characterizes a particular herbal medicine in the place of the hint of pine. Still, absolutely delicious.

I started adding them to my smoothies in the morning, and absolutely love it. I like it much better than flax seeds. Not just because they're better for you (flaxseed oil can actually increase your risk of liver cysts) but also because they are a softer seed, blend better, and don't get stuck in my teeth as badly.
title: Nutiva Organic, Raw, Shelled Hempseed , 8-ounce (Pack of 3)

Text: These shelled hempseeds are high quality and delicious. I love putting them in raw milk smoothies with raw eggs, cocoa powder and bananas. I also put them in raw chocolate macaroons to add a nutty richness to the taste. Everything that Nutiva makes is top notch and this product is no exception. I have these coming through Amazon's auto delivery program and I love having a constant supply of hemp seeds.
title: Nutiva Organic, Raw, Shelled Hempseed , 8-ounce (Pack of 3)

Summary: Nice fresh, creamy and nutty flavor
Text:
We use hemp seeds, hemp protein powder, chia seeds or walnuts every day for extra Omega 3's in our diet. I tried the Nutiva hemp seeds once and like them enough that I see no reason to try another brand and Amazon has the best price of the places I compared.

One serving is 3 tablespoons which is quite a lot, so keep that in mind when figuring cost per serving and when comparing various high Omega 3 products.

We use them sprinkled on top of salads or cooked veggies or sometimes I put them in my VitaMix machine along with extra firm tofu to blend them into a smooth paste as the base for a huge mixed fruit breakfast milkshake/smoothie. They are a very good way to add not only Omega 3's but extra protein to a meal and although the taste is very mild, they are quite good.

Do keep the package in the refrigerator after it is opened.
title: Nutiva Organic, Raw, Shelled Hempseed , 8-ounce (Pack of 3)

Text:
Not only does this pasta not get mushy when cooked a minute or three too long, but it holds up! I make baked mac and cheese that requires lots of stirring and most gf pastas break up and fall to pieces, but this pasta holds up to all the harassment. I really enjoy all the Tinkyada pastas, but this is the one I buy the most of!

Must have for any GF/CF kitchen!
title: Tinkyada Brown Rice Pasta, Elbows, 16 Ounce (Pack of 12)

Summary: So yummy Gluten-Free pasta, better than traditional pasta!
Text:
The ingredients are: brown rice, rice bran, water.

Excellent texture (basically the same as traditional noodles, just a tad thicker)

Excellent flavor, perhaps a bit richer/deeper/nuttier than traditional noodles (like the difference between white rice and brown rice)

Cooking time just a couple minutes longer than traditional noodles

My sister and I need to eat gluten-free, so we gave these noodles a shot with my mom's homemade mac and cheese recipe that we've always eaten growing up (Velveeta, milk, butter). These noodles actually made it taste BETTER than traditional noodles! My mom's sauce is pretty runny, which is how we've always eaten it, and for some reason, these noodles either soaked it up more, or caused it to thicken more. It created a nice, thick dish with a richer flavor than white noodles. We let some of the family taste it, and they all liked it better! Too bad they are so expensive, so we will only use them for the GF eaters in the family.

I can't wait to try the rest of the Tinkyada pastas for spaghetti, pasta salad, and fettuccini. Who says you can't have pasta when you are gluten-free?! Not me! Soooo good.
title: Tinkyada Brown Rice Pasta, Elbows, 16 Ounce (Pack of 12)

Text: This pasta is great for people with Celiac.  I think the taste is great and when you miss your pasta, this is a great subsitute.  It does take longer to cook and is better when rinsed in hot water before serving.  Does not go mushy like other brands.
title: Tinkyada Brown Rice Pasta, Elbows, 16 Ounce (Pack of 12)

Text: This is so great tasting. I used it to make macaroni salad and mac and cheese and both came out great. It does soak up liquid more so use extra. When I made the macaroni salad I had to add more mayonnaise twice while it was chilling. Leftover mac and cheese after a few hours was a little dry, but still tasted good. My non gf husband said it was the best mac and cheese he's had, and he also enjoyed the macaroni salad. He never likes whole wheat items so for him to like this says something about it. I also love that I can buy it in the grocery store instead of having to order it online. Tinkyada knows their (gluten free) stuff!
title: Tinkyada Brown Rice Pasta, Elbows, 16 Ounce (Pack of 12)

Text: This is by far the best gluten free pasta I have ever tried! It's firm and not mushy like some other brands out there are. My whole family eats this and even serve it to guests and nobody knows that it's gluten free! Best Pasta out there!
title: Tinkyada Brown Rice Pasta, Elbows, 16 Ounce (Pack of 12)

Text: My whole family is gluten free and I am grain free so can only use rice products.  This product is easy to use and tastes great in our tradition recipes.  Even my mother in law can fix meals we can eat without a problem.
title: Tinkyada Brown Rice Pasta, Elbows, 16 Ounce (Pack of 12)

Summary: Larger elbows, more water needed to cook than wheat pasta
Text:
I must say that I was pleasantly surprised when I cooked and ate the macaroni. The elbows are larger than the traditional wheat elbow macaroni. However, the taste is excellent, and I don't think that you can tell any difference in both taste or texture. I made macaroni and cheese with the rice macaroni for my grandson, and he loved it.

One thing that I did notice is that it does seem to soak up more water in the cooking process, so I would suggest adding more water to the pan than you would normally use if you were cooking the wheat counterpart. The first time I cooked the rice macaroni, the pan nearly ran dry of liquid before the macaroni was tender. But don't worry, it does not come out mushy. Just be sure to observe the recommended cooking times on the package and you will have a perfectly textured pasta that tastes great.
title: Tinkyada Brown Rice Pasta, Elbows, 16 Ounce (Pack of 12)

ProfileName: Desert Gypsy "A Brooklyn Girl Out West"""
Text:
I've tried many different brands and shapes of rice pasta over the years. Even if you find a brand you like, not every shape turns out to be good. This is one brand and shape combination that gets it one hundred percent perfect! The pasta is tasty and cooks up al dente; works well in recipes like macaroni and cheese, baked zit type dishes and just about any other recipe I've added it to.

One exception to the rule - when used in cold salads like macaroni salad, the macaroni tends to get hard when refrigerated overnight. It works just fine to bring macaroni salad to chilled temps but overnight seems not to work. Tomato sauces and cheese sauces don't seem to have the same problem.

Very pleased with this product and highly recommended.
title: Tinkyada Brown Rice Pasta, Elbows, 16 Ounce (Pack of 12)

Text: Both of my children cannot have gluten.  I used to make them gluten free pasta and my husband I would eat regular pasta until we found Tinkyada.  It is sooooo nice to make just one pot of pasta that the whole family will eat!!  My husband and I are a little more picky when it comes to leftovers.  There is a stronger taste the second day for some reason.  But they are great right off of the stove!
title: Tinkyada Brown Rice Pasta, Elbows, 16 Ounce (Pack of 12)

ProfileName: Vicky Loebel "Author: Keys to the Coven"""
Summary: The best of the best wheat-free pasta
Text:
We have both dairy and wheat allergies in the household and have tried pretty much every alternative pasta you can name, from quinoa spaghetti to brown-rice lasagna. As a rule, they cook up chewy, mush, or crumbly, with (in the case of brown rice) a slightly bitter flavor that can only be hidden with piles of cheese.

Of the pastas we've tried, Tinkyada is the clear winner, and this particular product stands head and elbows above the rest. It holds it's shape and texture through cooking (we use the 3 minute boil, 7-15 minute steep method), soaks up the flavors of sauces, and refrigerates well.

I also recommend Tinkyada brown rice pasta shells (cute in soup). And their lasagna noodles, which are delicate and hard to handle but produce a very good tasting lasagna.
title: Tinkyada Brown Rice Pasta, Elbows, 16 Ounce (Pack of 12)

Summary: next best thing to sliced bread
Text: I love these brown rice noodles.  The tinkyada brand doesn't stick like the others.  My cholesterol has diminished since switching from regular noodles.
title: Tinkyada Brown Rice Pasta, Elbows, 16 Ounce (Pack of 12)

Text: I am allergic to wheat and have tried many different brands and types of wheat free/gluten free pasta. The Tinkyada brand Rice pastas are the best I have found. The taste is very similar to standard white pasta. Rice pasta tends to have a mushy texture, even when undercooked, but when rinsed (as directed) the Tinkyada has a normal texture.
title: Tinkyada Brown Rice Pasta, Elbows, 16 Ounce (Pack of 12)

Summary: Great Gluten Free Pasta...That's also Soy & Corn Free!
Text: It's hard for me to find items that are Gluten Free as well as Corn and Soy Free much less ones that actually taste good.  I was recently diagnosed with Celiac's and along with an illness that has my on a strict diet I also can't have Corn or Soy which is most GF items.  Prior to my diagnosis and diet restrictions we still ate very healthy and I have been enjoying whole wheat pasta for years. Summary: Good snack and dessert for a good price
Text: I use this finely shredded coconut flakes for late afternoon snacks at work and sometimes as dessert at home. I mix 15 raw almonds (soaked in spring water for at least 8 hours) with 3 table spoons of coconut flakes and 1 table spoon of raw unheated honey. Try it... it is one of the best desserts for me. I don't eat white flour products or ice cream so this satisfies me just fine.  I was unable to find how they dessicate/dry the coconut flakes.  I am hoping that it is not very high temperature. It would be the best if they are air dried but most likely not the most practical way for commercial production. if someone knows how they are dried please leave a note.

Text:
This is the best gluten free spaghetti noodle I have used (although I must admit I have not tried Schar's spaghetti and it is probably good also as their other pastas are). All of bionaturae pastas are excellent as well.

After a little research on pasta there are some helpful hints that work with all types of pasta but are especially important with gluten free spaghetti.
Use as much water as your pot can hold, want good spaghetti, buy a bigger pot or use two pots that are appropriate for 6 ounces of pasta instead of 12 ounces.
*** Lots of water is vital to prevent spaghetti from sticking together.****
Too little water, the pasta becomes sticky as well as mushy.
NEVER add oil, I know it seems like a great idea but not only does not prevent spaghetti from sticking together but actually makes it more likely to occur.

Adding salt to water is helpful but not necessary.

Try adding your spaghetti very quickly, not slowly a few pieces at a time. Again, it seems like a good idea but it promotes sticky & mushy pasta. Why you ask? Because all pastas gluten free and non gluten free release a starchy substance that coats the pasta with in the first 2-3 minutes of being placed in boiling water. This is commonly called glutinous starch but of course it is not the wheat, rye or barley protein gluten. So adding individual strands prolongs this process of starch releasing and coating the strands of pasta increasing the likelihood of spaghetti stuck together. **** This is why is very, very important to use lots of water, and stir the pasta in the boiling water for the first 2-3 minutes to disperse the coating of sticky starch.****

Then proceed with package directions on timing of pasta. Of course I occasionally am distracted and boil the spaghetti noodles too long and am reward with mush.

Best of Luck.

PS my gluten free friend, Glutenfrieda is now making ice cream sandwiches that excellent.
title: Bionaturae Spaghetti Gluten-Free Pasta | Rice and Lentil Spaghetti Pasta | Non-GMO | Lower Carb | Kosher | USDA Certified Organic | Made in Italy | 12 oz (6 Pack)

Text: This is the best gluten free pasta out there...my kids and I have tried as many as we can find.  Hint--add a little canola oil (I don't know why the canola works and others haven't, I learned it from a chef a a celiac camp I went to last summer with my son--and it works) to the water while you are boiling and stir stir stir--I use a spaghetti spoon.  Do not walk away...If any of the strands start to stick together, use a fork and gently press against the side of the pot to make them come apart...then continue stirring. It's 8-10 minutes out of your evening, but if you miss spaghetti, it's totally worth it! This is not a pasta you want to assign to someone with ADHD (my husband cannot stand over the pot for the total of 10 minutes of stirring it takes..he grows bored)  lol, my point is that you have to pay attention to it to get it done right, and when you do it right it is just like regular pasta!  I have made it many many times with perfect results...good stuff!

Text: For my family, the two most difficult foods to replace when we gave up gluten were breads and pasta. We are so glad to have found this spaghetti.  Like the other GF pastas we have tried, it is best eaten when first prepared, so I no longer cook large quantities of pasta at a time, just what we'll eat at a sitting.  But we are all enjoying spaghetti again and that is a very good thing. One note for gluten-free households:  Bionaturae also makes regular pastas, so (as always) be sure you have the gluten-free one. Text:
In fact, in Japan these rice would cost about $50. But before you think most California short grain is the same, you need to try this or koshihikari. If you don't want to spend $30 (locally sell here for around $25) then some stores sell them in small container for under $10.

What's different about tamanishiki, koshihikari and other popular Japanese premium rice? The grain is even shorter than regular short grain rice people are used to in the USA. The texture is more 'plump' while the rice glitters with a very natural sweetness you don't normally get with regular American short-grain. It has a very subtle bite on the outer layer.

WASH your rice. I don't know why this isn't stressed in the bag anywhere. It's a standard procedure to wash the rice with cold water 3-4 times then fill the bowl and let the rice sit for 20 minutes. If you're using a rice cooker you'll know this 20-minute wait time makes a difference. I'll usually dump the water again and fill to the appropriate level and turn on the rice cooker.

Try it for yourself though; the price will seem much cheaper when you eat these premium rice and why it's used at home and almost all Japanese sushi restaurants that offer quality sushi and dinner. You won't be able to go back eating the regular $12 bag of 20-lb rice sold at your local grocery store.
title: Tamanishiki Super Premium Short Grain Rice, 15-Pound

Summary: Great Price, Great Taste, Great Sushi!
Text: The price is great, the rice tastes great, and the rice makes good sushi. I would (and have) recommended this product to friends. The only thing I dislike is the bag isn't re-sealable, but that's usual for rice. I recommend transferring to a re-sealable container or at least one that closes to keep moisture content low.
title: Tamanishiki Super Premium Short Grain Rice, 15-Pound

Text: OK, My wife and I spent three years in Okinawa Japan and fell in love with short grain sushi rice. With a good quality rice cooker you can't go wrong.
title: Tamanishiki Super Premium Short Grain Rice, 15-Pound

Text:

asin: highly recommend it. Here you go just for fun: 1 1/3 cups Japanese shot grain rice
title: 1 1/2 cups of water and this is for the mixture that goes into the all done rice to make it sticky and glossy and tasty of course. I almost forgot
brand: make shore you washed the rice before you cook it at list 4 to 5 times

very important!!.

Summary: The best sticky rice out there
Text: I love Tamanishiki rice, it's some of the best quality rice you can get. True it's a little more expensive, but a large bag like this lasts a while and I find it to be worth the cost for a rice-lover like myself.
title: Tamanishiki Super Premium Short Grain Rice, 15-Pound

Text: This rice is great.  I used to live in Japan and have become a serious rice connoisseur.  This rice is as good as the stuff served in Japanese restaurants.  A good short grain that is sticky, fluffy and very filling.  It is great for sushi, but also just a bowl of rice, curry or any other way you could want to eat it.  This rice is a little more expensive than other rice in this category, but it worth the cost.  I make it in a rice cooker and it always turns out great, washed or just straight cooked.  超美味いよ。
title: Tamanishiki Super Premium Short Grain Rice, 15-Pound

Text: Most people think rice is rice.  Once you try Tamanishiki, you can never go back to any of the other stuff.  There so much flavor in each bite.  The price is a little expensive but definitely worth every penny.
title: Tamanishiki Super Premium Short Grain Rice, 15-Pound

title: Tamanishiki Super Premium Short Grain Rice, 15-Pound

Summary: Use this for my Japan Recipe for Sticky rice served with anything
Text:
I love this product, My friend who is a associate of mine brought a Dish we all called sticky Rice.
We use the Short Grain Rice Product only to put in the Rice Cooker when making this, 2 Cups of Premium SHORT Grain Rice only ( Short Grain Rice is better for you and healthier ) 1/2 Cup of this Mizkan Base into the Rice Cooker along with your 1 and half cups to 2 cups water to cook depending on your taste, When Rice Cooker is finished you can Add a Bag of Fresh Peas to Blanch Steam in with them and Stir. Its a lovely side dish and delicious. Enjoy

This is awesome served with a piece of Grilled Chicken or Mesquite Chicken, Or just serve it by itself.
title: Tamanishiki Super Premium Short Grain Rice, 15-Pound

Text: Gingerbread Spice is wounderful. It not only tastes great but also helps with upset stomach, indigestion, or an acidy stomach. I recomend it to anyone with a touchy tummy, or anyone who just wants a great tea to curl up with on a cold night or morning.
title: Celestial Seasonings Holiday Tea Gingerbread Spice Herb Tea, 20-count (Pack of 6)

Text:
I love this tea as is but my favorite way is to make it with cider!

What I do is:
pour a cup of hot cider
add a teaspoon of honey
add a Celestial Seasonings Gingerbread Spice tea bag
ENJOY!

The perfect way to relax on a chilly evening!
title: Celestial Seasonings Holiday Tea Gingerbread Spice Herb Tea, 20-count (Pack of 6)

Summary: Best Ever - Hard To Find Though

I love this tea, it is now my favorite, and was sorry to not be able to find it anywhere this winter season. My guess is that it is just that popular. Celestial Seasonings Candycane tea with a bit of carob added to it is also one of their best.

Diane
title: Celestial Seasonings Holiday Tea Gingerbread Spice Herb Tea, 20-count (Pack of 6)

Text: The tree is up, the stockings are hung. The house is quiet now, and I'm sitting on the couch admiring the lights on the tree with this perfect warming cup of tea. Try it with a little brown sugar instead of white. Happy Holidays!
title: Celestial Seasonings Holiday Tea Gingerbread Spice Herb Tea, 20-count (Pack of 6)

Text: I bought these originally thinking they were honey and sesame.  As it turns out, they are sugar and sesame.  They do taste great but traditionally this type of snack should have honey instead of sugar.  If you are looking for a honey and sesame snack, there are others available through Amazon that contain honey instead of sugar, among those are [Joyva Sesame Crunch Candy].  If you are looking for a sugar alternative snack that is all natural, that is your best bet.

These sesame snacks are delicious. I buy them at a local grocery store for [...] per package and saw them as low as [...] for the 24 packs on [...] - but you have to spend at least [...] there or pay [...] for S&H, so Amazon is still king for best price overall.

I was surprised to find that people say they are a candy, because they seem so healthy with all the sesame seeds in them. Great for gluten-intolerant people who want something sweet that is not full artificial ingredients.

Great to have around. Unlike a previous reviewer, I do not find that they stick together in the package - it could be the region you live in with humidity and such. Highly recommend!

Text:
My wife and I were at a local winter sports outlet and I saw a box of these little treats on the counter. I bought one and liked it but their price was like $1.25 per pack. I figured if I ever found them at a decent price, I'd pick up some more.

So a couple of days later I found them on Anazon and bought a whole box for a quarter of the price I had paid at the snowboard shop.

The only thing I don't like about these little things is that they do NOT last long enough. My fault, I know - but next time I'm buying two boxes - maybe three.

They came fresh and crispy/crunchy and stayed that way for a couple of weeks. Ya gotta try some.

Text:
Sesame seeds are very healthy and nutritious; and of course they taste great. These little packets each contain four cracker-like pieces of thin, crispy nut brittle made with sesame seeds. They are sweet and satisfying and take away hunger pangs. I think they are a great thing to keep on hand at the office for those times when you can't take a lunch break, skipped breakfast, or will be working late. They seem to hold up forever too. They are a bit susceptible to humidity (just makes the four thin pieces stick together a bit) but really no problems.

These are also easy to carry in your purse etc. and while I won't say they will hold up in a car's glove box indefinitely (at least in a very hot climate), they will hold up for quite a while (like, months). They are good additions to an emergency food kit too (your earthquake or hurricane pack etc.).

I really can't imagine anyone not liking these; they are a very basic but appealing snack.
title: Sezme Sesame Snaps, 40-gram, (Pack of 24)

Text: I purchased a box of these after reading the great reviews. It arrived in less than a week, and I am blown away by how yummy these are. I have to refrain from eating more than one package. It's pretty high in calories and fat (230 calories, 14g fat), considering its small size. But then again, it's mostly healthy unsaturated fats and it does have a lot of healthy fiber (28% daily value fiber in each package!). I read another review that said these used to be made from just 2 ingredients (sesame seeds and honey); now they are made from 3 ingredients (sesame seeds, sugar, and glucose). I wish I could try it with honey, but these are still great. It's a pretty healthy snack when you consider the alternatives at the grocery store, loaded with ingredients that are barely pronounceable. Plus it's nice if you have a sweet craving and don't want fruit or candy. You may need to supplement it with something else as I ate a package and was still quite hungry afterward. Overall, I recommended you give these a try. I am usually a little bit skeptical of purchasing food based off of reviews but these tasted a lot better than I expected. Thumbs up.
title: Sezme Sesame Snaps, 40-gram, (Pack of 24)

Summary: SO good! And beats out Joyva's Sesame Crunch candies, hands down!
Text:
Ever since I was a child, I've loved this type of sesame candy. I'd been a die-hard Joyva Sesame Crunch candy fan, up until about a month ago, when I found these Louck's Sesame Snaps candies in my local World Market store (for a much higher price than they are here on Amazon). Man, these sesame snaps ROCKED my Sesame Crunch lovin' world! They're thin, and have no problems (from what I've seen so far, anyway) with staying crisp, I'm sure at least partly because of the change in dimensions. Joyva's Sesame Crunch candies are just as delicious, as long as humidity doesn't get to them and make them a super sticky, pieces-stuck-EVERYWHERE-in-your-teeth mess. With these thinner, wider snaps, I don't expect the gumminess issue to be a problem.

Yes, these obviously have sugar in them, but being so chock-full of fiber and protein-rich sesame seeds, I really think these are one of the healthiest guilty pleasures to be found in the candy aisle! Go for 'em - they're delicious, and at a GREAT price here, too!
title: Sezme Sesame Snaps, 40-gram, (Pack of 24)

Text:
The flavor of these nuts is similar to cinnamon toast cereal, yet they are filling and healthy, containing little sugar and almost no salt. I would deduct a star for being priced too high both here and in the supermarket, but Blue Diamond deserves credit for their restraint in using quality ingredients and in not producing a sugar encrusted candy. Now if they would only go against the trend of charging a huge markup for minimal extra processing cost...

The other reviewer seems to think these contain lactose. The ingredients:
ALMONDS, EVAPORATED CANE JUICE, BROWN SUGAR, CORN MALTODEXTRIN, CINNAMON, NATURAL FLAVORS AND SALT. PEANUT FREE. MAY CONTAIN OTHER TREE NUTS. Unless OTHER TREE NUTS comes from cows, I don't think this is true.

Text:
Diamond Almonds
Almonds are a good source of magnesium. One ounce contain approximately 20% of the RDA for an adult recommended dietary allowance (RDA)
Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA) the amounts of selected nutrients considered adequate to meet the known nutrient needs of healthy people. The RDA is based on scientific knowledge and has been presented by a committee of the Food and Nutrition Board (FNB) of the National Academy of Sciences (NAS). The Canadian equivalent is the Recommended Nutrient Intakes. RDA is generally accepted throughout the world as a valid source of information. At least 40 different nations have as well as organizations have published standards similar to the RDA.

Magnesium is the fourth most abundant mineral in the body and is essential to good health. Approximately 50% of total body magnesium is found in bone. The other half is found predominantly inside cells of body tissues and organs. Only 1% of magnesium is found in blood, but the body works very hard to keep blood levels of magnesium constant.
Magnesium is needed for more than 300 biochemical reactions in the body. It helps maintain normal muscle and nerve function, keeps heart rhythm steady, supports a healthy immune system, and keeps bones strong. Magnesium also helps regulate blood sugar levels, promotes normal blood pressure, and is known to be involved in energy metabolism and protein synthesis. There is an increased interest in the role of magnesium in preventing and managing disorders such as hypertension, cardiovascular disease, and diabetes. Dietary magnesium is absorbed in the small intestines. Are you taking enough magnesium in the diet? The recommended daily allowance is 300mgs/day for men, 350mgs for women. Magnesium is extremely safe by mouth - too much simply causes diarrhea. Try increasing the amount of magnesium you take by mouth until it causes diarrhea, then reduce the dose slightly so it does not. This is called taking magnesium to bowel tolerance (just like using vitamin C to bowel tolerance.

Almonds are a good source of Fiber.
One ounce contains approximately 12% of the RDA for an adult.
So, in summary, Almonds are a very healthy snack, so what's left to say?

Two things:
1st be cautious about "bowel tolerance"" or ""happy bowels"" if you prefer.
2nd Taste. I realize that taste is a personal thing. That's why they make chocolate
asin:
and vanilla.

Here's my current favorites""

1st Blue Diamond Dark mint dark chocolate (reminds me of the chocolate mint Girl Scout Cookies with less sugar).

2nd Blue diamond Dark Chocolate Oven Roasted
3rd Blue diamond Blue Butter Toffee
4thd Blue Diamond Almonds Bold Habanero BBQ (reminds me of BBQ potato chips again with less sugar).
5th Bold Blazin Buffalo Wing
6th Blue Diamond Almonds Cinnamon Brown Sugar
7th Blue Diamond Almonds Lime `n Chili
8th Blue Diamond Almonds Smokehouse
9th Bold Wasabi & Soy Sauce

But that's just me: you might have a completely different take on these flavors.
4th and 5th are very close.

Gunner
May
listing_url: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Dark Chocolate, 30-ounce bag

Text:
At first, I thought these tasted a little artificial. After a few handfuls I realized I like them, regardless.

I am a big fan of this company's products, and have even gone so far as to speak with one of their growers about the integrated pest management systems they employ (using the smallest amount of pesticides possible). I will keep buying all their other flavors. The Bold line, especially the Habanero, is also excellent, as are the dark chocolate variety.
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Dark Chocolate, 30-ounce bag

If you are trying to follow a low-carb lifestyle (for dietary reasons or weight loss) and need a 'sweet fix' after meals, then this is a wonderful option - only 6 g. Net carbs! And the taste is so yummy! They are just sweet enough! I'm so glad that amazon sells them in bulk, because I could easily go through one container in a week!

Text: If you want a truly healthy, filling snack, you must give these a try, as well as their sisters, the Vanilla Bean Almonds. They are both just lightly sweetened, and fragrant with either the cinnamon or the vanilla, depending on which you choose. The container is marvelous; there is a half flip top which is easy to do with one hand (like in the car). And they're not roasted in more oil, so the almonds are "meaty"" and sweet. And almonds are SOOO good for you. I'd recommend that you try them
initial_identifier: and then get an Amazon subscribe and save if you can. It's well worth it! And all natural. LOVELY!"

I try to eat a handful a day, usually as a mid-afternoon snack for optimum health benefits. The handy container is easy to use and even indicates portion size.  Unfortunately, this type of almonds is getting more and more difficult to find in my local stores, so I was happy to be able to order a 6-pack from Amazon to have in my pantry.

title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Dark Chocolate, 30-ounce bag

Text:
I ordered these lovely almonds a few weeks ago, as I often find myself jonesing for junk food, and I thought that if I had something that was good for me around, I would be less likely to grab something terrible. These nuts are packed with nutrition, and they taste amazing. They have just enough flavor to make me want more, but the fact that they are high in fat makes it difficult to eat too many in one sitting; I'm satiated with two handfuls. I go through one little container every week or so. They are perfect for anyone concerned with nutrition or trying to put on or keep muscle- they pack 6 grams of protein in 1 oz. I will definitely be re-purchasing these nuts. I wasn't so keen on the idea of the canisters, as I don't like producing so much waste, but I have purchased nuts (peanuts etc) in the past in bulk, and they did go bad before I finished eating them.
These nuts have kept me out of the icecream, chocolate chips, and other naughty sweet things that have little nutritional content. These nuts taste like they should be bad for you, but they are more similar to vitamins than junk food; read the back for the nutritional content: 35% Vitamin E, 15% Phosphorus, 20% Magnesium, 35% Manganese....the list goes on...:)

Update: I ordered my second shipment of these. I love these and I eat a handful of these almonds after my morning banana yogurt shake and with my vitamins :)
title: Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Dark Chocolate, 30-ounce bag
